blt10f5cba4dfb3d00f.title: Glendale
blt10f5cba4dfb3d00f.location_amenities_disclaimer: † Facilities and entertainment are subject to change.

overview.short_overview: Overlooking the Solway Firth, an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty which forms part of the border between England and Scotland, lies Glendale Holiday Park, an undiscovered gem in the heart of Cumbria.
overview.long_overview:
When you own a caravan in Cumbria at Glendale Holiday Park, not only will the glorious county’s countryside be yours to explore, but the park is also set just a stone’s throw away from the dramatic coastline, putting you in the perfect position to enjoy many water and land-based activities.

Keen walker’s and cyclists can choose from an array of popular trails including part of Hadrian’s Wall which passes right by the park. Nature-lovers can relish in the thriving plant and animal life at the nearby Glasson Moss Nature Reserve. Or if fishing or water sports take your fancy, the Cumbria coast has many great spots and organised activities for those of all experience levels. At our holiday park in Cumbria you’ll be just 12 miles away from the vibrant city of Carlisle with it’s great shops, bars and restaurants, alongside the 900-year old cathedral which is well-worth a visit. You may also choose to cross over the border into Scotland where Gretna Green; the home of romance, and the market town of Dumfries are within easy reach.

If simply relaxing on-park is more your style, you’ll have everything you need at your fingertips, all set amongst the beautiful park surroundings. Unwind at the unique swim-spa and sauna during the day, and relax on an evening with a tasty meal at the Lakeside Bar & Bistro, or meet up with your fellow owners for a night of entertainment at the Lakeside Lounge. The little ones can burn off their energy at the fun-filled children’s play park, or try their hand at mini golf.

Owning a holiday home in Cumbria means you’ll be spoilt for choice of things to do each time you visit. But don’t just take our word for it, why not arrange a park visit today to take a tour of the park, experience the local area, and find out more about owning a caravan in Cumbria at Glendale Holiday Park.

highlights.title: Located in an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty

overview.short_overview: An ideal location for a peaceful escape in the Peak District.
overview.long_overview:
Perfectly located to explore the stunning Derbyshire countryside, Newhaven Holiday Park offers the best of countryside holidays and is ideal for a peaceful and secluded touring getaway.

Nestled in the heart of the Derbyshire Peak District, the national park is yours to explore. Offering a spectacular variety of scenery from dramatic high moorlands to cascading waterfalls, the Peak District National Park is an area of dramatic natural beauty on a breath-taking scale making it one of the finest areas in the country to go walking or cycling. Couple the amazing scenery with the bustling market towns and picturesque villages of Ashbourne, Bakewell, and Tideswell, this touring caravan site in the Peak District will, sure enough, become one of your favourite destinations.

Newhaven also puts you in the perfect spot for more adventurous days out with Carsington Water just a short drive away offering a wide range of water sports for all the family to enjoy. Or if you’re more of a thrill-seeker, Alton Towers and Gulliver’s Kingdom are both less than half an hour’s drive away, giving you the best of both worlds as you can return to a tranquil setting after a day full of adventure.

Back on-park you can enjoy quality time to relax and unwind. This beautifully maintained park includes picnic and barbeque areas so you can make the most of the summer months, along with a play area, a well-stocked shop, and modern shower and toilet blocks, so you have everything you need for your touring holiday in the Peak District.

highlights.subtitle: Peaceful and secluded countryside location

bltf15b6dae72bd89b4.title: The Bay at Pevensey

overview.short_overview: The perfect seaside destination for a great golf holiday in Sussex.
overview.long_overview:
The Bay at Pevensey Holiday Park is set just yards from the beach and features sweeping panoramic views of Pevensey Bay and its sailing club. The park covers six acres, together with a 33-acre, nine-hole golf course, and provides the perfect setting for a golfing holiday with the family.

A walk along the beach will take you to the local shops, pubs and restaurants, while just a short drive from the property is the village of Pevensey, with its striking castle (now an English Heritage site).

Further along the coast are the towns of Bexhill-on-Sea and Eastbourne, with the Sovereign Harbour Marina, a great place for a spot of lunch whilst admiring the wide variety of boats moored up. The Towner, also in Eastbourne, is a stylish contemporary art gallery which is not to be missed - nor are The Observatory Science Centre and impressive Herstmonceux Castle, the same grounds just a short drive away.

Back on site, the golf club cafe serves light refreshments, wine and beer throughout the day, plus occasional Saturday night BBQs on the deck overlooking the course - ideal after spending the day sightseeing or relaxing on the beach.

This Eastbourne holiday park is set just a few minutes' drive from the livelier Pevensey Bay Holiday Park - The Bay offers a quieter holiday destination, with full use of all the facilities at the nearby park to use at your leisure.

Our fantastic selection of self-catering lodges (including pet-friendly options) offers plenty of options for great-value self-catering holidays, and you’ll find a wide choice of home-cooked, hearty meals in the inviting restaurant at our neighbouring park.

So, if you want a stress-free golf holiday by the seaside, you’re going to love The Bay at Pevensey Holiday Park.

Back on the park, the golf club cafe serves light refreshments, wine, and beer throughout the day - offering you the perfect setting to relax in after spending the day sightseeing, relaxing on the beach or improving your golf swing, with holes ranging from 110 yards right up to 350 yards!

blt6e9cdb37e6fb1011.title: Chichester Lakeside

overview.short_overview: A picturesque setting with fishing lakes - close to the wonderful West Sussex coast.
overview.long_overview:
Located just outside the historic town of Chichester, West Sussex, this holiday park probably has more water than land! This means 10 large fishing lakes set in over 150 acres of beautiful Sussex countryside, yet positioned only a few miles from the beach, and the traditional seaside resort of Bognor Regis.

The entertainment centre boasts a fantastic bar with an outdoor terrace overlooking the lake. It has a range of dining options, and is a great place for meeting other holiday guests on this scenic park. It's also adjacent to our heated outdoor swimming pool so close enough for a refreshing dip between beverages.

The park is also handily situated just 15 minutes from (amongst other venues) Chichester Golf Club so golfers should be happy. There's also historic Arundel Castle and Harbour Park Amusements to explore nearby.

Or should you enjoy a trip to the beach, you’ve a pleasant drive to the Blue Flag beach at West Wittering or the popular south coast resort of Brighton. Chichester Lakeside is a great Sussex destination so why not visit us this summer?

For a touch of extra comfort why not explore our luxury lodges range?

The ultimate in Park Holidays UK accommodation, our range of prime location lodges offer innovative roomy design and luxurious fixtures and fittings, perfect for holiday living.

For full information regarding fishing click here or please contact the park directly using the "Contact Us" button.

blt3c08f86290ed6c4f.title: Ashbourne Heights

overview.short_overview: The perfect location for quiet escapes in the Peak District
overview.long_overview:
Explore the captivating Peak District from Ashbourne Heights, an unforgettable, fully featured holiday park.

Nestled high up in the countryside, you’ll enjoy breathtaking views of the national park, plus direct access to the famous Tissington Trail, perfect for walking or cycling.

Offering both peace and relaxation and fun and adventure, Ashbourne Heights boasts a wide range of accommodation including lodges, luxury caravans, and a glamping pod complete with its own hot tub.

On-park facilities include a heated indoor pool, The Rally Room for relaxation, children’s outdoor play area, shop, and much more.

It’s also the ideal base from which to explore this beautiful region, with everything from bike trails and theme parks to museums and stately homes – plus the region’s famous wildlife parks, limestone caverns and waterparks – within easy reach.

Perfect for those who love exploring the great outdoors, or simply wishing to get away from it all, this Derbyshire gem has it all.

overview.long_overview:
Immerse yourself in the magical Peak District during a stay at Ashbourne Heights, an unforgettable, fully featured Derbyshire holiday park.

From its elevated countryside position, you’ll enjoy breathtaking views of the national park, plus direct access to the famous Tissington Trail, perfect for walking or cycling.

Whether you’re bringing your tent, caravan or motorhome, our Peak District camping and touring site is the perfect choice for holidays in the heart of the countryside. Surrounded by rolling hills, picture-postcard villages, top family attractions and great local amenities, it’s no wonder Ashbourne Heights is such a popular choice for holidaymakers wishing to experience the best of this magical setting.

On-park facilities include a heated indoor pool, the Rally Room for relaxation, children’s outdoor play area and shop – plus spotlessly-clean showers and toilets, launderette, and much more.

With a range of great-value pitches available – all carefully positioned with space and privacy in mind, from simple solutions to en-suite luxury – Ashbourne Heights is perfect for exploring the great outdoors and getting away from it all.

overview.short_overview: Located in the stunning Peak District countryside, Ashbourne Heights Holiday Park is a popular location for those who love exploring the great outdoors.
overview.long_overview:
The opportunity to own your very own caravan or lodge holiday home in the Peak District could become a reality for you at Ashbourne Heights. Our Holiday home owners love being able to escape to one of the most scenic locations in the UK whenever they choose.

The convenient facilities at Ashbourne heights are located in a small cluster of traditional brick buildings and include an indoor swimming pool, reception and small convenience store. There are plenty of picnic tables and outdoor areas to relax and enjoy the tranquil setting or watch the younger enjoy themselves in the play area.

Accessed directly from the park, the famous Tissington Trail has been created from the last of the Victorian railways and runs for 13 miles through some breath-taking Peak District scenery – use the trail for a safe and enjoyable walk to the market town of Ashbourne.

Owning a holiday home in the Peak District at Ashbourne Heights Holiday Park is an easy and enjoyable experience. We have a range of makes and models to suit most budgets and you can also enjoy a valuable extra income with our popular, easy to understand letting scheme when you are not using it.

Why not come and visit to find out more? Be our guests for the day and enjoy all the park facilities, a warm welcome awaits. On your visit you’ll be able to view the latest range of caravan holiday homes and lodges for sale.

blta312a0bd3a70d547.title: Polperro

overview.short_overview: Stunning location with spectacular views over Talland Bay and out to sea
overview.long_overview:
Offering superb views across Talland Bay, Seaview Holiday Village is surrounded by glorious countryside, and just minutes away from historic Cornish fishing villages Polperro and Looe.

It’s also ideally positioned to access Cornwall’s award-winning attractions and must-visit destinations, such as the Eden Project and Land’s End.

This small, friendly park boasts a range of free facilities, plus entertainment for the whole family and plenty of open space for games and picnics. There’s an indoor pool, games room, children’s club, restaurant, bar and playgrounds, plus unmissable evening entertainment in the clubhouse.

If you want to relax, chill out in the steam room and sauna, limber up for a game of table tennis or pool, or let the kids loose on a full programme of activities and events for children of all ages – including interactive stories, dancing, bingo and much more.

Our range of caravans, bungalows and chalets (including pet-friendly options) means plenty of options for great value self-catering holidays, and you’ll find a wide choice of home-cooked, hearty meals in our inviting restaurant.

Enjoy a taste of the Cornish lifestyle at the unforgettable Seaview Holiday Village.

overview.short_overview: Polperro Holiday Park occupies an elevated position less than 2 miles from the quaint fishing village of Polperro, with its narrow streets, pretty cottages, and amazing views out to sea.
overview.long_overview:
Previously known as Seaview Holiday Village – and renamed to better capture the unrivalled draw of this sought-after retreat – Polperro Holiday Park offers easy access to the local area.

Travel a few miles east to visit the thriving port of Looe, or travel east for 10 miles via the Bodinnick Ferry to reach the beautiful estuary town of Fowey, made famous as the residence of Daphne du Maurier. Polperro Holiday Park really is the perfect location from which to explore this stunning coastline and owning a caravan or lodge holiday home will allow you to do just that. We have a wide selection of holiday homes to suit all tastes and budgets.

Whilst the location of Polperro Holiday Park is one of the reasons it’s so popular with holiday home owners, the warm welcome and superb facilities add to the appeal. Holiday home owners enjoy the relaxed atmosphere and community spirit which is strong within our owner community. Outdoor space is particularly generous at Polperro Holiday Park – perfect if you want to enjoy relaxing with your four-legged friend. And because of its popularity with holiday guests, there’s a great opportunity to enjoy a valuable extra income and let your holiday home when you’re not using it with our popular and easy to understand letting scheme.

Owning a holiday home in Cornwall at Polperro Holiday Park could soon become a reality.

bltab31a4100c5eca2f.title: Waterside

overview.short_overview: Amazing Devon sea views on the English Riviera coast in Paignton.
overview.long_overview:
On the cusp of the Paignton area lies Waterside Holiday Park, with its spectacular views of the South Devon coastline and the ocean.

From its elevated position, you will enjoy stunning picture postcard views of the Torbay coastline, and it is close to the fabulous beaches and attractions of the famed English Riviera. Stay at Waterside and you can take a trip to beautiful Goodrington Sands, an award winning Blue Flag beach ideal for swimming and topping up the tan.

There's so many good reasons to spend a holiday or short break at Waterside. Relax in our friendly clubhouse and enjoy a tasty bite to eat. During the day you can also recline on the Sun Terrace, with a drink in hand, while the kids have a splashingly good time in the heated outdoor pool.

Waterside is renowned for its amazing setting, along with the famous Steam Railway that borders the park. With easy access out onto the headland, guests can walk through the tunnel under the Steam Railway to remarkable views of the Torquay coastline and coastal paths great for dog walkers and hiking. It's all here in this ideal Devon location.

The wonderful sights come courtesy of the hillside location so it's not particularly suitable for anyone who struggles with slopes, but don't worry, if you prefer your park to be on a flat surface we can thoroughly recommend our sister park, nearby Dawlish Sands.

Our holiday accommodation is based on the flattest part of the holiday park, with parking in most areas just a short walk away.

highlights.title: Picture postcard views
highlights.subtitle: of the South Devon coastline and ocean

highlights.title: Entertainment for the whole family
highlights.subtitle: Even more on offer during school holidays

overview.short_overview: Waterside Holiday Park is situated in Paignton on the South Devon coast. It enjoys the climate and attractions that have made this area the English Riviera. And with great facilities, top class family entertainment and some of the best views imaginable.
overview.long_overview:
Waterside Holiday Park, just outside Paignton, enjoys stunning sea views and is situated right at the heart of Devon’s English Riviera. With superb park facilities it’s a true beach lover’s paradise.

The clubhouse is one of our finest with plenty of room to take in some entertainment or just to enjoy a quiet drink with new friends. Meanwhile the lido style pool is in a sun-trap setting, so you can enjoy a dip or soak up some of the famous English Riviera weather. And did we tell you about those views? They really are something to behold; you can see the whole of Torbay from Torquay to Brixham, and we even have a Steam Railway running along the edge of the park!

Once people see Waterside they rarely want to leave. With your own holiday home here you can visit anytime during the season. It's also a great place to explore the area, all the attractions of South Devon are close at hand, including the Blue Flag award winning beach, Goodrington Sands. We are also right on the coastal footpath so you can enjoy walking, hiking and the great outdoors in all its magnificent glory.

We hope that you agree Waterside is a rather special place. If you are interested in your very own holiday home in Devon, you may want to come and see us sometime. We have a wide range of holiday homes and lodges to suit all budgets... a warm welcome awaits!

blt3d35f99c80bb3aef.title: Pevensey Bay

overview.short_overview: A wonderful Sussex Park close to Eastbourne and the South Downs.
overview.long_overview:
Visit Pevensey Bay Holiday Park in Sussex for a fantastic holiday destination. Come and enjoy the relaxed environment and invigorating sea air. With a glorious beach right on your doorstep you are never far from a spectacular sea view.

With loads of space for kids to play and a wonderful beach front, our friendly Holiday Park has a host of fantastic holiday features to enrich your stay. You can have a great time here at Pevensey Bay Holiday Park with an indoor swimming pool, gym, entertainment venue and adventure playground too.

Pevensey Bay Holiday Park is in a much-lauded part of Sussex, very close to the popular seaside towns of Eastbourne, the rolling hills of the South Downs, and bohemian Hastings. It's a place steeped in history with Pevensey Castle, Battle Abbey and Herstmonceux Science Centre all a short drive (or bus ride) away. There's so many great reasons to visit Sussex - find out why today!

For a touch of extra comfort why not explore our luxury lodges range?

The ultimate in Park Holidays UK accommodation, our range of prime location lodges offer innovative roomy design and luxurious fixtures and fittings, perfect for holiday living.

overview.short_overview: In the heart of '1066' country, Pevensey Bay Holiday park oozes exclusivity with perfectly landscaped grounds and private access to miles of stunning Sussex Coastline.
overview.long_overview:
Enjoy the relaxed environment, refreshing sea air and a whole host of park facilities including a 9-hole golf course, perfect for both families and those looking for a quiet holiday home getaway.

Take a dip in the heated indoor pool, socialise with like-minded owners in the modern restaurant and bar, or simply sit back and enjoy the views from our outside terrace. The children will never be short of things to do with an outdoor play area, children’s shallow pool and Loopy Kids Club to keep them entertained over the season.

If you come prepared for water sports activities, Pevensey Bay Holiday Park offers a boat and jet ski storage yard, available exclusively to owners, for as little as just over £8 per week, in addition, jet ski launching facilities are also available*.

Pevensey Bay Holiday Park is in an enviable location, with views out to Beachy Head in one direction and the seaside town of Hastings in the other. It’s a place steeped in history, with Pevensey Castle, Battle Abbey and Herstmonceux Science Centre all a short distance away.

For this coastal retreat we have plenty of choice, with holiday homes and lodges available for a wide range of budgets. Get in touch today to find out more.

bltd700b17134ebbf06.title: Hengar Manor

overview.short_overview: A beautiful holiday park with a country club feel in the heart of north Cornwall
overview.long_overview:
Located in the heart of Cornwall and set on a stunning country estate, Hengar Manor occupies the grounds of a 35-acre country estate and is a great location from which to explore the delights of North Cornwall.

With the rolling hills of Bodmin Moor nearby and the popular seaside towns of Port Isaac and Padstow a short distance away, it is easy to see why we are such a popular choice for a Cornwall holiday.

The Park offers a wide variety of self-catering accommodation from cosy cottages and cabins by the lake to lodges and bungalows – giving you a perfect base to enjoy your holiday in Cornwall.

On-park there is a wide range of activities including an indoor swimming pool, restaurant, bar and nightly entertainment. Kids and families alike will enjoy our Get Active adventures such as Archery or you can laze the days away on one of our three coarse fishing lakes. Further afield we’re close to the many amazing highlights Cornwall has to offer.

Our well-stocked fishing lakes are open year-round. They vary in size and provide a perfect experience for beginners as well as offering more challenging conditions for the experienced angler. Board license required – please see website for full details. Our bait and tackle shop stocks all the fishing essentials.

Our North Cornwall holiday park is the perfect place for a relaxing break with your friends and family.

overview.short_overview: The popular North Coast of Cornwall is a perfect place to own your new Holiday Home. Hengar Manor Holiday Park is located close to Padstow, Polzeath, Wadebridge and Port Isaac, providing endless local adventures and beautiful scenery in this county.
overview.long_overview:
Hengar Manor is a hidden gem located in the heart of Cornwall, within a secluded 35-acre country estate, and close to some of North Cornwall’s finest coastal destinations such as Padstow, Polzeath, Rock Beach and Port Isaac.

Tintagel Castle is one of the most spectacular historic sites in the UK, so you can get close to the legend of King Arthur after a short 20 minute drive. The picturesque village of St. Tudy, with its long and distinguished history, is situated in the River Camel valley, approximately five miles northeast of Wadebridge, and a short 5 minute drive from the park - perfect for a countryside stroll. There are endless quaint villages nearby to the park, from Camelford just 10 miles north of Bodmin, to St. Mabyn in the west, making this holiday park the perfect Cornwall retreat location.

We have an exclusive selection of caravan holiday homes and lodges for sale. However, when you own a holiday home at Hengar Manor, you may find you never want to leave the park. With mature trees, the stunning manor house, beautiful grounds, and a choice of 4 fishing lakes, this park provides something for all outdoor pursuits. Inside the main complex you will find a large 25m swimming pool, a choice of restaurant or café bar, a popular entertainment venue and a convenient store for all your essentials (and a few non-essential items as well!)

Escaping to your very own holiday home at Hengar Manor will offer the kind of lifestyle you’ve always dreamed of where beautifully landscaped grounds on a country estate are just outside your door and great Cornish hospitality and service is available throughout your stay, whether that’s the weekend, a week or much longer.

Owning a holiday home in Cornwall at Hengar Manor Holiday Park could soon become a reality. Why not come and visit to find out more? Be our guests for the day and enjoy all the park facilities, a warm welcome awaits. On your visit, you’ll be able to view the latest range of caravan holiday homes and lodges for sale.

blt912fbd8df28546cc.title: Silver Sands

overview.short_overview: Stunning seaside holiday park on the beautiful Moray Firth coast
overview.long_overview:
Silver Sands, near Lossiemouth on the beautiful Moray Firth coast, is named for the sparkling stretch of beach that runs alongside the park.

It’s the perfect holiday destination for anyone looking to explore North-east Scotland and the Highlands. Take advantage of some of the driest weather in the UK to spot bottlenose dolphins, go surfing, sailing or horse riding, or simply enjoy the picturesque coastline. Lossiemouth is a haven for golfers and plane spotters, while intrepid adventurers can take to the Grampian Mountains or the Highlands, Cairngorms National Park and Inverness.

The park itself features a heated indoor pool, sauna and fitness suite, clubhouse with restaurant and bar, adventure playground, shop, kids club, launderette, and even a takeaway that specialises in delicious fish and chips.

When evening arrives, Silversands comes alive with entertainment for the whole family, including shows, Toddler Time sessions, karaoke, quizzes, bingo, competitions and more.

With accommodation from lodges to luxury glamping pods (complete with en-suite bathrooms and hot tubs), Silver Sands is all about fun-filled seaside holidays – whether it’s a great line-up of live entertainment, family fun in the pool or days at the beach, it’s the perfect place to create some amazing holiday memories.

highlights.subtitle: Sparkling stretch of beach runs alongside the park

overview.short_overview: A fantastic holiday park with direct access to a huge sandy beach
overview.long_overview:
Silver Sands, situated near Lossiemouth on the magical Moray Firth coast, is named for the sparkling stretch of beach that runs right alongside the park.

Silver Sands is the perfect touring destination for anyone looking to explore North-east Scotland and the Highlands – from dolphin spotting and surfing to golfing and walking, the location offers plenty to do, and some of the driest weather in the UK.

Nearby Lossiemouth is a haven for golfers and plane spotters, while the more adventurous can easily reach the Grampian Mountains, Cairngorms National Park and Inverness.

A range of grass and hard-standing gravel pitches provide an excellent foundation for touring and camping holidays. Many offer the convenience of electricity, water and drainage points near the entertainment complex and within easy reach of the beach, while the new en-suite pitches come with their very own private shower and toilet facilities.

The park boasts a heated indoor pool, sauna and fitness suite, clubhouse with restaurant and bar, adventure playground, shop, kids club, launderette, and even a takeaway that specialises in fish and chips. There’s also evening entertainment for the whole family, including unmissable shows, Toddler Time sessions, karaoke, quizzes and bingo.

Silver Sands promises a fun-filled seaside holiday – from great live entertainment to family fun in the pool and days at the beach, it’s the perfect place to create some amazing holiday memories.

overview.short_overview: Located next to a sparkling stretch of golden sandy beach where the park gets its name, Silver Sands.
overview.long_overview:
Silver Sands Holiday Park is located just outside the traditional fishing town Lossiemouth although it is perhaps better known for its proximity to some of the UK’s finest links golf courses these days.

In fact, the famous Moray Golf Club is all that lies between the park and the town itself. Lossiemouth is also well know for its RAF base which is home to the Eurofighter. Holiday home owners and guests enjoy the occasional close flyover which would otherwise only be experienced at an air show.

The appeal isn’t just because of it’s wonderful location; the park lies beneath with impressive Covesea Lighthouse, is spaciously laid out and enjoys amazing views, particularly from the dunes out to sea or from the rooftop terrace of your luxury lodge.

A warm welcome awaits all of our holiday home owners and still retains a small park community atmosphere, despite boasting the range and quality facilities you would expect from a larger park. Our indoor pool, sauna, gymnasium, entertainment venue and restaurant are all located under the same roof in the middle of the park so your whole family can enjoy different facilities at the same time.

Owning a holiday home on the Moray Firth at Silver Sands Holiday Park is an easy and enjoyable experience. We have a range of makes and models to suit most budgets and you can also enjoy a valuable extra income with our popular, easy to understand letting scheme when you are not using it.

Why not come and visit to find out more? Be our guests for the day and enjoy all the park facilities, a warm welcome awaits. On your visit you’ll be able to view the latest range of caravan holiday homes and lodges for sale.

bltbdf95b6eb9ad4b69.title: Felixstowe Beach

overview.short_overview: The resort of Felixstowe is renowned for its stunning beaches, all of which are close by.
overview.long_overview:
Felixstowe Beach enjoys a fantastic coastal location, just minutes away from a stunning beach along the Sunrise Coast, and regularly appears in our top 3 for customer satisfaction.

On the park, you'll find a heated indoor swimming pool complete with flume - ideal for younger guests and those who are just young at heart, a family clubhouse complete with restaurant, family bar, amusement and arcade area, and an adventure playground!

Even though Felixstowe Beach is not an entertainment park, during the school summer holidays the park provides fantastic toe-tapping live cabaret shows - perfect for the whole family to enjoy!

Felixstowe is an attractive Victorian town, known as the 'Garden Resort of the East Coast'. This is due to its extensive and beautiful gardens, situated along its long, level promenade and in the town centre. The seafront gardens are listed on the English Heritage Register of Parks and Gardens of National Importance.

Don't forget to visit Southwold during your stay, it's one of those must-see places, and boasts a gorgeous Blue Flag beach!

So many great reasons to visit Felixstowe Beach. We look forward to welcoming you to the park soon.

highlights.subtitle: Just minutes away from the stunning beach

overview.short_overview: Felixstowe Beach Holiday Park is a great place for your Suffolk holiday home. With lots of great park facilities, Felixstowe's many tourist attractions within a short walk, and an award-winning beach - this is a great spot the whole family will enjoy.
overview.long_overview:
Felixstowe Beach is the perfect location for your Suffolk Holiday Home by the sea. It enjoys a very popular location - set right at the heart of the famous and well-kept holiday resort. It could be the ideal location for your very own holiday home on the beautiful Suffolk coastline, with the area's attractions within easy reach.

On the park you'll find a great indoor pool complete with water slide for children of all ages. The entertainment complex is perfect for the regular live shows and cabarets or a quiet drink with friends.

Felixstowe is an attractive Victorian town, known as the "Garden Resort of the East Coast". This is due to its extensive and beautiful gardens, along with its long, level promenade and pretty town centre. The seafront gardens are listed on the English Heritage Register of Parks and Gardens of National Importance. As a major working port, the horizon is ever-changing with ships and boats arriving from all corners of the world.

Owning a holiday home at Felixstowe Beach may cost less than you would imagine - we have a wide range of static caravans for sale for all budgets. And with a long season, you can enjoy your holiday home by the sea for most of the year. We invite you to come and be our guests for the day, explore the park and view the latest models for sale. A warm welcome awaits!

blt6aea2bd554bcef47.title: Burghead

overview.short_overview: Set next to a stunning bay, surrounded by rural countryside and only minutes from unspoilt sandy beaches.
overview.long_overview:
Burghead Holiday Park offers a peaceful and relaxing stay, situated on the edge of Burghead - sitting peacefully between vast woodlands on the south, beautiful, clear blue seawater in the bay, and sandy beaches in the north.

The park is adjacent to the beach and provides the perfect peaceful setting for your touring caravan or motorhome holiday!

A short two-minute stroll from the park will take you to the beautiful coastal village of Burghead, where you’ll find quaint local shops and country pubs - you can also walk or cycle the Coastal Trail east, toward Hopeman, two miles away, which also has all the amenities described above plus an 18-hole golf course.

Moving further inland, you can visit the town of Elgin, which has breathtaking scenery, a huge amount of character and a number of local distilleries including Glen Moray, Gordon & MacPhail and Glen Elgin, most of which have open days for the public and whisky trails. The town also hosts a fantastic selection of shops, pubs and restaurants.

Back on-site, although there are no facilities on the park, our pitches are well maintained and have all the space you need to enjoy the great outdoors - late autumn is particularly spectacular on the park, as you can often see the aurora borealis light up the evening sky, and dolphins and whales can be spotted in the bay.

At the same time, if you’re looking to enjoy a little entertainment, relax in a pool or enjoy an evening meal, our fantastic neighbouring destination at Silver Sands Holiday Park is set just an 11-minute drive from Burghead Holiday Park, and you can use it at your leisure.

If you're looking for a relaxing, chilled-out seaside pitch in Lossiemouth, you’ll love Burghead Holiday Park.

overview.short_overview: A serene park nestled between the Moray coast fishing village of Burghead and Roseisle Country Park
overview.long_overview:
Located right on the beach, Burghead Holiday Park boasts stunning views of the Moray Firth coastline and Burghead harbour, not to mention miles of golden sandy beach right on your doorstep and Roseisle Country Park for walking trails and an abundance of wildlife. Often the aurora borealis lights up the evening sky whilst dolphins and whales can be spotted in the bay.

Burghead is a beautiful coastal village with many amenities including local shops, pharmacy and a local outdoor bowling club a short distance nearby. Burghead also has the well documented 'Pictish Site' and Burning of the Clavie at Doorie Hill, which has become a very popular tourist attraction over the years. You can also walk or cycle the Coastal Trail east, toward Hopeman, 2 miles away, which also has all the amenities above plus an 18-hole Golf Course.

A warm welcome awaits all of our holiday home owners with a small park atmosphere and like-minded community. Owning a holiday home on the Moray Firth at Silver Sands Burghead Holiday Park is an easy and enjoyable experience, from forest to whisky trails, there’s something for everyone.

We have a range of makes and models to suit most budgets and you can also enjoy a valuable extra income with our popular, easy to understand letting scheme when you are not using it. Why not come and visit to find out more? On your visit you’ll be able to view the latest range of caravan holiday homes and lodges for sale. Be our guests for the day, a warm welcome awaits.

A nature lovers paradise with bird, bottle-nose dolphin and Orca watching
Ideally located to explore the Scottish Highlands, golf courses and famous whisky trails

blt3dacd2620c9098e4.title: Lossiemouth

overview.short_overview: Set on the banks of the stunning River Lossie, only minutes away from gorgeous unspoilt sandy beaches.
overview.long_overview:
Lossiemouth Holiday park is situated on the North-east coast of Scotland on the banks of the River Lossie and is surrounded by picturesque countryside, but just a short stroll from gorgeous unspoilt sandy beaches, where you can enjoy birdwatching, long walks or spotting the famous bottlenose dolphins.

The park offers a relaxing retreat sitting peacefully between vast woodlands in the south, but only a short distance from the livelier neighbouring park, Silver Sands, also located in Lossiemouth, which offers a wide selection of facilities - which you are welcome to use at your leisure.

A five-minute walk from the park will take you to the centre of Lossiemouth, where you will find local shops, pubs and quality seafood restaurants, while just a short drive from this idyllic Moray holiday park you’ll find breathtaking views of the golden sands of East Beach stretching away to Lossie Forest and Spey Bay beyond.

To add to this spectacular location, the Moray Golf Course (considered to be one of the finest links courses in Scotland) is less than a five-minute drive away - giving you the best of both worlds, and turning your seaside break into a golfing holiday. Inland, less than 15 minutes’ drive away, nestled on the banks of the River Lossie, you can start your Whisky Tour by visiting Glen Moray Distillery - a small, friendly whisky distillery set in the heart of Elgin. Enjoy a relaxed tour around the distillery before breathing in the famous Angels’ Share while taking a look inside one of their warehouses. Alternatively, just venture nine minutes from the park to kick-start your Castle Trail, at Spynie Palace (Elgin), Scotland's largest surviving medieval bishop's house, and residence of the bishops of Moray for 500 years.

Back on-site, our double-glazed, self-catering accommodation offers you superb value for money, and is ideally placed for exploring the local area, and spacious enough to enjoy as a home away from home.

However, if you’re looking to enjoy a little entertainment, relax in a pool or enjoy an evening meal with friends, our fantastic neighbouring park, Silver Sands Holiday Park, is set just seven minutes’ drive from Lossiemouth Holiday Park, and you can use it at your leisure.

So, if you’re looking for a relaxing seaside break next to beautiful beaches, dense forests and stunning historic sites, you’re going to love Lossiemouth Holiday Park.

overview.short_overview: Situated on the North East Coast of Scotland, Silver Sands Lossiemouth is the perfect retreat location for your holiday home.
overview.long_overview:
Ideally situated on the edge of Lossiemouth, sitting peacefully between vast woodlands on the South and the River Lossie with sprawling sandy white beaches to the North. Just a few strides from the park will take you onto the beautiful sandy beach where you can enjoy bird watching, long walks or spotting the famous bottle-nosed dolphins.

A five minute stroll from this popular Holiday Park will take you into the centre of Lossiemouth where you will find many facilities and attractions, such as the Fisheries Museum, local fishing permits and a sailing club to name a few. Plenty for all the family to enjoy.

This idyllic holiday home location boasts close proximity to the infamous Moray Golf Club and well known RAF base, with holiday home owners and guests enjoying a close view of some spectacular aircrafts occasionally passing by. Head just 2 miles south of Lossiemouth and you will find Spynie Palace, Scotland's largest surviving medieval bishop's house and with one of Scotland’s finest medieval stronghold’s, Duffus Castle, a mere 10 minute drive away, there’s plenty to explore.

A warm welcome awaits all of our holiday home owners with a small park atmosphere and like-minded community. Owning a holiday home on the Moray Firth at Silver Sands Lossiemouth Holiday Park is an easy and enjoyable experience, from forest to whisky trails, there’s something for everyone.

We have a range of makes and models to suit most budgets and you can also enjoy a valuable extra income with our popular, easy to understand letting scheme when you are not using it. Why not come and visit to find out more? On your visit you’ll be able to view the latest range of caravan holiday homes and lodges for sale. Be our guests for the day, a warm welcome awaits.

overview.short_overview: This fun-packed park has top-class facilities and is a short drive to nearby sandy beaches
overview.long_overview:
Discover a beautiful coastline and create memorable family holidays at Sand Le Mere.

Overlooking Tunstall beach, this pet-friendly holiday park is your gateway to the East Yorkshire coast, with easy access to the nearby towns of Hornsea, Filey and Scarborough, plus a great range of on-park features.

As well as an impressive leisure complex, indoor pool, sauna, steam room, gym, restaurant, bar, fishing lake and evening entertainment, there’s a host of family-friendly amenities, including adventure playgrounds, indoor soft play, crazy golf, a stimulating sensory playroom, pool activities, balance bikes, archery and more.

From the fun-packed Kids Club to activities for teens and engaging evening entertainment, holidaymakers are truly spoilt for choice at Sand Le Mere!

Offering both static caravans and luxury holiday lodges, Sand Le Mere offers some of the region’s best-value escapes, at a stunning seaside location.

Overlooking Tunstall beach, this pet-friendly park offers easy access to the beautiful East Yorkshire coast, as well as a huge range of on-park features.

Park up and enjoy the park’s impressive leisure complex, indoor pool, sauna, steam room, gym, restaurant, bar, fishing lake and evening entertainment, plus a host of family-friendly amenities including adventure playgrounds, indoor soft play, crazy golf, a stimulating sensory playroom, pool activities, balance bikes, archery and more.

From the fun-packed Kids Club to activities for teens and engaging evening entertainment, you’ll be truly spoilt for choice!

And there’s a huge range of pitches for touring caravan or motorhome owners – from simple grass pitches to hardstanding pitches with electricity, plus luxury en-suite spaces with their own showers and toilets.

Offering some of the region’s best-value escapes, at a stunning seaside location, Sand Le Mere has it all.

overview.short_overview: Sand le Mere is perfectly situated on the prime coastal town of Tunstall, with direct beach access to glorious stretches of golden sands. Fantastic on-site facilities, including leisure complex with swimming pool and a fishing lake!
overview.long_overview:
People choose holiday home ownership at Sand le Mere for many reasons, but everyone loves the perfect location right on the beach, with stunning views looking out to sea and local tiny fishing villages. Excellent facilities and a fishing lake also help to make this the idyllic Yorkshire holiday park.

East Yorkshire's breath-taking countryside is a given here, but as a holiday home owner at Sand le Mere you get the best of both worlds, coast and countryside.

Sand le Mere itself has great facilities and the atmosphere is very friendly, with a strong focus on our owners community. You can make use of the swimming pool plus we organise a whole host of owners’ only events throughout the season too.

Sand le Mere is a fantastic location for fishing, whether you’re an experienced fisherman or a novice, our park is perfect for anglers of all abilities.

Owning a Yorkshire holiday home at Sand le Mere may be more affordable than you think, with a huge range of models available for all budgets. You can also enjoy a useful income with our letting scheme when you are not using it - or you can keep it all to yourself, the choice is yours!

Why not come and visit to find out more? Be our guests for the day, discover the coast, enjoy the great outdoors and enjoy all the park facilities, a warm welcome awaits.

blt481ef35fe3527df1.title: Turnberry

overview.short_overview: Head north and escape to the Ayrshire coast to discover a world of peace and tranquillity at Turnberry Holiday Park.
overview.long_overview:
There’s a lot more to Turnberry than golf, although it has to be said that there are few destinations in the world with a better reputation for the sport.

The views out across the Firth of Clyde on a clear day are spectacular and these can be taken in from our bar and restaurant venue whilst enjoying a drink or a nice meal.

Facilities also include a small indoor pool and sauna room, and a safe and secure children’s play area which is conveniently located just outside the Ailsa clubhouse, complete with picnic tables and benches.
Whilst the location, tremendous views and facilities on the park are all important reason for owners choosing to purchase either a holiday caravan or lodge at Turnberry Holiday Park, the relaxed community atmosphere is what makes our park so popular with owners, whether they visit occasional weekends or for several weeks at a time throughout the season. It’s just a great park to make friends with people who have a shared love of the lifestyle.

Owning a holiday home on the West Coast of Scotland at Turnberry Holiday Park is an easy and enjoyable experience. We have a range of makes and models to suit most budgets and you can also enjoy a valuable extra income with our popular, easy to understand letting scheme when you are not using it.

Why not come and visit to find out more? Be our guests for the day and enjoy all the park facilities, a warm welcome awaits. On your visit you’ll be able to view the latest range of caravan holiday homes and lodges for sale.

blt0fa567ba8924c401.title: Bowland Fell

overview.short_overview: An idyllic location with superb facilities
overview.long_overview:
Uniquely positioned in rolling countryside, close to the Yorkshire Dales and the Lake District, Bowland Fell is the ideal destination for lovers of the great outdoors.

With more than 130 acres to explore, plus access to the nearby Forest of Bowland, this holiday park is perfect for walking, cycling and spotting wildlife, and has also been recognised as a Dark Sky location, making it the perfect place for stargazing.

The park itself offers a range of self-catering options including luxury holiday lodges, caravan holiday homes and luxury holiday apartments, all of which are finished to a high standard.

On-park features include the 17th-century Crowtrees Inn, restaurant, heated indoor pool, park shop and children's play areas.

Bowland Fell gives holidaymakers the opportunity to drink in the spectacular views, walk the hills and visit dozens of idyllic destinations nearby, including chocolate-box villages and top attractions – it really is the complete package!

highlights.title: Spectacular views
highlights.subtitle: Beautiful surrounding countryside and forest

highlights.title: Indoor heated swimming pool
highlights.subtitle: Restaurant, park shop and children's play areas

highlights.title: Near the Lake District
highlights.subtitle: Great base to explore from the Yorkshire Dales

overview.short_overview: Nestled in the countryside a short distance from the Yorkshire Dales and within driving distance of the Lake District.
overview.long_overview:
Ideally located in between the Yorkshire Dales National park and the Forest of Bowland Area of Outstanding National Beauty, it would be difficult to imagine a better caravan or lodge holiday home location if you enjoy fresh air and stunning natural scenery.

Our superb facilities are centred around a large courtyard and include the Crowtrees Inn, originally a 17th century farmhouse and now beautifully restored venue for dining and socialising, also boasting a popular beer garden. Our light and airy Park shop and reception features a great range of local produce. Opposite the Crowtrees Inn is our lovely heated indoor Swimming pool – what more could you ask for?

The atmosphere on the park is very relaxed and friendly where like-minded holiday home owners have formed a great community spirit. There are a range of caravan holiday homes and lodges available to purchase with prices to suit all budgets.

Bowland Fell is located in an area that has been recognised as a Dark Sky Friendly Location which means it is far from light and other pollution – great for stargazing but it means that you can truly escape from the hustle and bustle of everyday life – whenever you want.

Owning a holiday home on the edge of the North Yorkshire Moors at Bowland Fell Holiday Park is an easy and enjoyable experience. We have a range of makes and models to suit most budgets and you can also enjoy a valuable extra income with our popular, easy to understand letting scheme when you are not using it.

Why not come and visit to find out more? Be our guests for the day and enjoy all the park facilities, a warm welcome awaits. On your visit you’ll be able to view the latest range of caravan holiday homes and lodges for sale.

highlights.title: Great base from which to enjoy the great outdoors
Stunning views of the surrounding countryside
Indoor pool, convenient mini-mart and safe play areas

blt9ff4a29e15153a2d.title: Coghurst Hall

overview.short_overview: A beautiful lakeside setting in Hastings. Great facilities near the East Sussex coast.
overview.long_overview:
Coghurst Hall is set on the edge of the historic coastal town of Hastings hidden in a beautiful tree-lined valley. With family friendly facilities, a stunning fishing lake, and the many attractions of East Sussex close by, Coghurst Hall is the perfect location for your holiday or short break.

The lord of the manor has long since departed but the beauty of the country estate remains. The focal point of this woodland Park is its impressive lake which is well stocked with a range of fish, and includes some monster carp - so don't forget your fishing rod!*

The clubhouse offers traditional, stately decor with a laid-back atmosphere, so you can relax and unwind in plush surroundings. Our indoor pool is unique and gives the impression you could be swimming through underground caves!

Hastings is just a short drive away and is enjoying a transformation as a fashionable holiday resort. The Old Town is a hotspot of trendy bars and restaurants whilst the traditional seaside amusements, boating lake and crazy golf course (which incidentally holds the "World Crazy Golf Championships" every year) remain as popular as ever.

So come and visit Coghurst Hall for your Sussex holiday, we're sure that you'll be impressed.

*For full information regarding fishing please contact the park directly using the "Contact Us" button at the top right of this page.

highlights.title: Acres of natural woodland
highlights.subtitle: With a fantastic fishing lake

highlights.title: Great entertainment
highlights.subtitle: The whole family will love!

overview.short_overview: Coghurst Hall is set on the edge of the historic coastal town of Hastings hidden in a beautiful woodland valley. With great family friendly facilities, a well stocked fishing lake and the many attractions of Hastings close by, Coghurst Hall is the perfect location for your Sussex holiday home.
overview.long_overview:
Coghurst Hall near Hastings - a beautiful setting for your country holiday home, and it's open for an 11.5 month season!

Coghurst Hall enjoys a spectacular countryside location and an exclusive feel from the moment you arrive through the secure entrance and driveway. The lord of the manor may have long since departed, but the beauty of the country estate remains.

The focal point of the Park is its impressive lake which is well stocked with a variety of freshwater fish, including some monster carp. Owners create a genuine community atmosphere in our stately-looking clubhouse, which has enjoyed refurbishment in recent years, but still maintains its manor house charm.

Meanwhile our unique indoor pool could give you the impression that you are swimming through underground caves!

Hastings is just a short drive away and is enjoying a transformation as a fashionable resort. The Old Town is a hotspot of trendy bars and restaurants, and there are excellent shopping facilities in the main town centre with plenty of convenient parking.

With a range of static caravans and lodges for every budget your Sussex holiday home could cost less than you might imagine. And with a 11.5 month season you can enjoy holidays throughout the season. Come and visit us at Coghurst Hall to find out more. A warm welcome awaits!

blt4a0cb3c8dc112110.title: Winchelsea Sands

overview.short_overview: Miles of sandy beaches nearby, so don’t forget to pack your sun lotion.
overview.long_overview:
Located between the historic towns of Rye and Hastings, Winchelsea Sands is the perfect base to embrace the region's history and its many attractions.

Not that you need to leave the park as we have everything you could wish for right here, including a fantastic entertainment venue (busiest at weekends and during the summer season), and a beautiful outdoor swimming pool.

If you do leave the park and go exploring you will be spoiled for choice. There are lovely beaches located nearby (the stunningly sandy Camber Sands is particularly popular), perfect for those who enjoy soaking up the rays, building sand castles or long leisurely walks by the sea.

Or you can explore the nearby nature reserve with its amazing views and wonderful range of English wildlife, particularly its stunning variety of birds.

Culture vultures will love the nearby town of Rye with its castle, art galleries and quirky selection of fun shops. A bit further away visit the Hop Farm for a great family day out with soft play, rides, farmyard animals, and even a driving school for children - beep beep!

Whether you prefer to stay on the park and take advantage of the great entertainment or would rather explore the magnificent 1066 country, a visit to Winchelsea Sands is highly recommended.

overview.short_overview: Winchelsea Sands Holiday Park is in East Sussex, superbly situated between Hastings and the medieval hill-top town of Rye. You'll find it's a superb location for your Sussex caravan holiday home - with delightful views over rolling countryside and just a short stroll to the beach.
overview.long_overview:
A great place to own a Holiday Home on the East Sussex Coast. Located between the historic towns of Rye and Hastings, Winchelsea Sands is the perfect base to enjoy the regions' history and many attractions.

Not that you need to leave the park as we have plenty onsite including a great entertainment venue (busiest at weekends and during the summer season) and a terrific lido style swimming pool.

If you do leave the park and go exploring then you are spoiled for choice. There are some lovely beaches just a short stroll away - ideal for long walks by the sea, soaking up the sun's rays or building sand castles. There is also the famously pretty Camber Sands; it may require a short drive, but is well worth the trip.

Culture vultures will love the nearby town of Rye with its castle, art galleries and diverse range of quirky shops. It really could be the perfect location for your East Sussex holiday home by the sea.
And it could cost less than you might imagine - we have static caravans and Lodges available for a range of budgets. You can even choose to make some extra money by sub-letting when you are not using it yourself.

We invite you to come and see Winchelsea Sands for yourself, enjoy the park facilities and let us show you the huge selection of holiday homes available. A warm welcome awaits!

bltf26a8f23833a6241.title: Rye Harbour

overview.short_overview: Idyllic location in Rye Harbour on the East Sussex coast by a nature reserve.
overview.long_overview:
Rye is one of those must-see places in the UK, and where better to stay than at Rye Harbour Holiday Park, situated alongside the harbour and adjacent to a nature reserve renowned for its wonderful wildlife, birds and flora.

Rye town centre is just 2 miles away from the park, and we wouldn't be surprised if you spend several days exploring the history and culture of this fascinating town. This traditional town features a delightful mix of quaint cobbled streets, art galleries, bars and fine bistros.

There’s also miles of amazing coastline to walk and sandy beaches to relax on in the area, including nearby Camber Sands, famously one of the best beaches in the Sussex county.

The family clubhouse on park provides regular cabaret shows and tours on the weekend throughout the school summer holidays, and Sky and BT Sports are available for those all-important sporting fixtures.

The small indoor pool may not be Olympic-size, but it's perfect for children and adults who just want to splash about and have holiday fun.

There are so many great reasons to experience Rye Harbour Holiday Park this holiday season, we look forward to seeing you at the park soon.

highlights.title: Stunning Nature Reserve
highlights.subtitle: Miles of amazing coastline to walk

highlights.title: Peaceful & tranquil setting

overview.short_overview: Rye Harbour Holiday Park offers a unique setting for your Sussex caravan holiday home. Set on the edge of a large nature reserve, near Rye in East Sussex, Rye Harbour enjoys views towards the delightful Rye harbour and across the water to Rye Golf Course.
overview.long_overview:
Rye Harbour is a small, friendly park with a genuine 'family feel', and is the perfect setting for your East Sussex Holiday Home on the coast.

Rye is one of those must see places that everyone should visit; situated alongside Rye Harbour and adjacent to a renowned nature reserve, it offers an unrivaled opportunity for nature lovers to discover the stunning wildlife and flora of this wonderful region.

Amenities on the park are perfect for the holiday home owner community. The Family clubhouse is a popular meeting place, whether for a spot of light evening entertainment or a quiet drink with friends. You can enjoy the free WiFi access in the bar, and Sky and BT Sport TV is available for those all-important sporting fixtures.

The small indoor pool may not be Olympic-size but it's perfect for children and adults who just want to splash about or relax. Rye town centre is just 2 miles away from the park and bursting with wonderful cafes and restaurants, with bohemian Hastings a short drive west. However, with miles of coastal walks to explore, hugely pleasant days can be spent at Rye without ever having to get in the car.

Holiday home ownership may be more affordable than you think, with static caravans for sale for a range of budgets. We have a wide selection of makes and models of caravan holiday homes available, so be our guests for the day and enjoy the park facilities if you want to find out more.

A warm welcome awaits at Rye Harbour!

blt43283a33213b8e21.title: Suffolk Sands

overview.short_overview: A small, relaxing park right on the seafront at Felixstowe.
overview.long_overview:
Not all our holiday guests look for caravan parks with big entertainment venues, lively bars, and busy swimming pools. They prefer an attractive holiday park in an excellent location by the sea, where peace and quiet is just the tonic to escape the stresses and strains of everyday life.

If that sounds like your cup of tea, and you're looking for a caravan holiday in wonderful Suffolk, then you might want to consider Suffolk Sands Holiday Park in Felixstowe?

If you do fancy the occasional swim or meal out all holiday guests at Suffolk Sands have full use of the facilities at our sister park, Felixstowe Beach, just down the road.

Suffolk Sands is situated between the estuaries of the Rivers Orwell and Deben on the coast and is the perfect base for exploring the heritage coast and rural villages that Suffolk has to offer.

The park is also just a minute from the beach. Come visit us, you'll be surprised how much Suffolk Sands has to offer.

As mentioned please note that there are no facilities at this park, they are all located at nearby Felixstowe Beach Holiday Park.

A welcoming reception and beautifully landscaped grounds, and all just a stone's throw from the sea. If you are looking for a peaceful location for your holiday home by the coast, it would be hard to find anywhere better than Suffolk Sands.

Suffolk Sands is situated between the estuaries of the Rivers Orwell and Deben on the coast and is the perfect base for exploring the superb heritage coast and rural villages that Suffolk has to offer. The park is also only a minute from the beach!

Holiday home owners enjoy the gentle, relaxed atmosphere, but have the option of using all the facilities of our sister park, Felixstowe Beach just a short drive away, perfect for when the children or grandchildren are staying.

If that sounds like your slice of heaven, then you should consider Suffolk Sands Holiday Park in Felixstowe. We are at the end of the Promenade, with some holiday homes even featuring a sea view.

We have holiday homes and static caravans for sale for a wide range of budgets so it needn't cost the earth for your Suffolk haven! Come and visit to find out more, be our guests for the day and we will show you around. A warm welcome awaits!

blt81f7f184c3abe831.title: Pakefield

overview.short_overview: A perfect seaside escape on the Sunrise Coast of Suffolk
overview.long_overview:
New to Park Holidays UK – Set on Suffolk’s enchanting Sunrise Coast, Pakefield Caravan Park boasts breathtaking sea views and offers guests direct access to a sand and shingle beach.

For those wishing to strike out further afield, Pakefield provides easy access to the coastal villages and hidden rural gems of Suffolk and Norfolk.

Take a short drive through open countryside, past windmills and waterways, to discover the picturesque Norfolk Broads, a series of lakes and rivers that combine to form one of Britain's most loved wetland destinations. Rich with numerous wildlife species, the Norfolk Broads are also home to intimate pubs and village retreats.

Known for its colourful beach huts and brewery, Southwold, a historic seaside town, is also just a short drive away. Even closer are traditional seaside resorts Lowestoft and Great Yarmouth, offering a circus, fairground, aquarium and some truly captivating beaches – Dunwich and Aldeburgh are naturally scenic.

Inland, meanwhile, the well-preserved Medieval Wool towns Lavenham and Clare are well worth a visit.

Pakefield has everything required for an unforgettable holiday – heated outdoor pool, a club with seasonal family entertainment, launderette, children's playground and a shop are just a few of the facilities guests can enjoy. There’s also dedicated holiday accommodation for the elderly and some disabled customers.

And no-one has to be left behind. Pets are welcome all season at Pakefield, and there are plenty of coastal and countryside walks to be enjoyed nearby.

The Pakefield holiday season runs from 19th March to early November.

highlights.title: Stunning, peaceful setting
highlights.subtitle: Wonderful coastal views

highlights.subtitle: Direct access to this lovely beach

highlights.subtitle: Swim whatever the weather

overview.short_overview: A perfect seaside escape on the Sunrise Coast of Suffolk. Pakefield Caravan Park is a four-star destination near Lowestoft, Suffolk. Overlooking the North Sea, the park offers direct access to the delightful Suffolk Coast, with breathtaking sea views and a sand and shingle beach.
overview.long_overview:
On-site, facilities range from shop, launderette, children's playground and a club offering seasonal family entertainment, to a luxurious heated outdoor swimming pool.

Pets are welcome, and there are plenty of beautiful coastal and countryside walks to be enjoyed nearby.

For owners wishing to explore further afield, Pakefield offers easy access to the coastal and rural villages of Suffolk and Norfolk, plus seaside resorts Southwold and Great Yarmouth.

It’s just a short, picturesque drive away from the Norfolk Broads, a series of lakes and rivers that comprise one of Britain's best-loved natural attractions.

Also within a short drive are historic Norwich, the ancient burial site of Sutton Hoo and Framlingham Castle, plus children’s entertainment at Africa Alive and Pleasurewood Hills theme parks.

Pakefield is the ideal location for a holiday home, and the combination of handy on-site facilities, rich natural wonders and engaging seaside towns nearby makes it one of Park Holidays’ most popular destinations for those looking for a home away from home beside the sea.

blt1843136c38895e66.title: Carlton Meres

overview.short_overview: A wonderful holiday park with loads to offer based in sunny Suffolk.
overview.long_overview:
With its well-stocked fishing lakes, tranquil location and abundance of leisure facilities, Carlton Meres Holiday Park is an ideal place for your family holiday.

Facilities include an outdoor pool, a fully-equipped gym, an indoor pool, an upgraded adventure playground, and a new-look clubhouse with restaurant, bar, gaming and relaxation areas.

Carlton Meres also has much to offer lovers of natural beauty and boasts a wealth of wildlife in its ancient woodland setting. Within easy reach of the park is the picture-postcard Suffolk Heritage Coastal Region, including the seaside towns of Aldeburgh and Southwold.

Nearby Walberswick, famed as the official home of "The British Open Crabbing Championship" is well worth exploring, with Framlingham and Orford Castle a must-see for any history buffs in the family.

Our gated holiday park also has a special appeal to anglers with a raft of different species eager to bite, including carp of up to 40 lbs, and regular fishing tournaments*.

For a touch of extra comfort why not explore our luxury lodges range?

The ultimate in Park Holidays UK accommodation, our range of prime location lodges offer innovative roomy design and luxurious fixtures and fittings, perfect for holiday living.

*Charges for fishing apply. For full information regarding fishing please contact the park directly using the "Contact Us" button at the top right of this page.

overview.long_overview: Set in a stunning woodland location with well-stocked fishing lakes and an abundance of leisure facilities, the whole family will love Carlton Meres Holiday Park. Opt for a truly unique experience in one of our popular camping pods, which offer a cosy break without the hassle of putting up a tent! Carlton Meres is the perfect base for a visit to the beaches of Aldeburgh, Southwold or Walberswick or further afield you have Felixstowe and Lowestoft – each contains its own unique treasures to discover. Park facilities include indoor and outdoor swimming pools, an adventure playground, a fully-equipped gym and a new-look clubhouse with a restaurant, bar and arcade area. For more information about fishing at Carlton Meres, please see our fishing page or call our friendly Reservations Team on 0343 178 7070.

overview.short_overview: Whatever you’re looking for from your holiday home, Carlton Meres is the perfect escape. The park offers the perfect countryside retreat, with two large lakes and a variety of on-site leisure activities, restaurant and bar.
overview.long_overview:
Set amongst beautiful mature woodland and two fishing lakes, Carlton Meres is the perfect location to buy a holiday home retreat.

There are plenty of facilities for the family to enjoy including an outdoor pool, children’s play area and a fully equipped gym, with a recently built entertainment complex and indoor swimming pool. The clubhouse includes a bar and restaurant where you can relax in comfortable surroundings and enjoy entertainment for the entire family.

With wonderful countryside and surrounding coastline, Suffolk is a rich and varied place to explore. A short 10 minute car journey takes you to the popular seaside town of Aldeburgh where you can sample the finest fish and chips. A little further north you’ll find the award winning pier and busy harbour at Southwold.

Those looking to explore the area’s fine heritage, can take a long country walk or spend an afternoon meandering around the quaint streets of countryside towns. You will be spoiled for choice with places to explore around Carlton Meres Holiday Park.

Carlton Meres offers up to an 11.5 month ownership season with holiday homes and lodges for a wide range of budgets. We also offer a range of flexible finance packages to assist with your holiday home purchase, so why not get in touch with us today?

blt75a6496240b7c6fe.title: Broadland Sands

overview.short_overview: The perfect location for your UK holiday on the east coast.
overview.long_overview:
Broadland Sands, between Great Yarmouth and Lowestoft is in the perfect location for your holiday, and right on the border between Norfolk and Suffolk. Situated on the beautiful east coast, you are in the perfect spot to do some exploring in both counties!

There is a great selection of facilities on the park, including a spectacular indoor pool with 45-metre flume and paddling pool, a roarsome dinosaur-themed adventure golf course, a family entertainment venue, a sports bar and lounge, plus a restaurant and takeaway.

Of course, if you do decide to leave the park, you will be spoilt for choice with the local area.

Why not visit the nearby Lowestoft beach which boasts two piers with great pubs, cafes, picturesque gardens and amusements? Or maybe lose all concept of time taking in the majestic scenery of the Norfolk Broads?

Whatever you choose, we know that you will love Broadland Sands Holiday Park and all that it has to offer. We look forward to welcoming you soon!

For a touch of extra comfort why not explore our luxury lodges range?

The ultimate in Park Holidays UK accommodation, our range of prime location lodges offer innovative roomy design and luxurious fixtures and fittings, perfect for holiday living.

overview.long_overview:
Situated close to the beach and with a great selection of park facilities, a holiday home here is ideally positioned to enjoy the attraction of both counties. Nearby Lowestoft Beach boats two piers, amusements, pubs and cafes, while the fishing on the Norfolk Broads is especially renowned among anglers (and the majestic scenery by nature fans).

You don't actually need to leave the park to fill your leisure time; why not take some time to splash around or relax in our indoor heated swimming pool or socialise in the clubhouse with a drink and great company? Make the most of the park atmosphere with like-minded owners watching the important sporting fixtures in our sports bar with big screen TV. The park also has a sports pitch, tennis court, arcade, adventure playground and even a crazy golf course.

We know that you will love a holiday home at Broadland Sands Holiday Park. With a wide range of models for every budget, why not arrange a VIP visit today and see the park for yourself?

blt5124a3a746ab2db8.title: Birchington Vale

overview.short_overview: Birchington Vale is a relaxing holiday park set in 100 acres of Kent countryside.
overview.long_overview:
Boasting miles of golden sandy beaches and close to the popular seaside resorts such as Margate and Westgate on Sea, Birchington Vale is a premium location for your family holiday break.

Birchington Vale is close to the village of Birchington, alongside four picturesque sandy bays, all easily accessed and providing great watersport opportunities for sailing and windsurfing. Nearby Minnis Bay provides incredible beach views and is extremely popular with dog walkers.

Explore this fascinating part of Kent from a wonderful park location. Write your own “Canterbury Tale” with a visit to the nearby historical town or find out why the traditional “Fish & Chips” seaside resort of Margate is now considered a trendy hotspot with a stop-off at the Turner Contemporary. (Don't worry, you can still get great Fish & Chips).

Other local attractions include Howletts Wild Animal Park (with the largest group of gorillas in human care in the world), Deal Castle, The South Foreland Lighthouse or slightly further afield (16 miles from the park) the majestic White Cliffs of Dover.

There's plenty to do on the park for holiday guests at Birchington Vale, with a Clubhouse and Indoor Pool with Flume, a Crazy Golf course, arcade and an adventure playground.

For a touch of extra comfort why not explore our luxury lodges range?

The ultimate in Park Holidays UK accommodation, our range of prime location lodges offer innovative roomy design and luxurious fixtures and fittings, perfect for holiday living. So why not visit Birchington Vale for the ultimate Kent Holiday this summer?

bltb426c8a05e9f667e.title: Marlie

overview.short_overview: A great setting close to New Romney on the South Kent coast - not far from the beach.
overview.long_overview:
Marlie enjoys a countryside location, but is just a short drive from the coast. Perhaps, more accurately, it's a golf swing and a half from the sea, as Littlestone Golf Club is situated between Marlie and the nearest beach - so don't forget your clubs!

Marlie is a beautiful countryside park set between the Kentish villages of New Romney and Dymchurch. It’s perfect for families with young children offering great park facilities to keep the kids entertained, including a modern entertainment venue and restaurant. The new heated indoor pool (built-in 2020) is ideal for a dip after a busy day out exploring Kent.Take a tour here

Take a tour here, and there's an adventure play area too.

Marlie is also a beacon for nature lovers. Adjacent to the park is a site of special scientific interest (sssi), Dungeness, a shingle-based setting that shelters a large area of low-lying land called Romney Marsh. It's home to a huge variety of migratory birds, uncommon plants, insects and more. The visitor centre is very close to the park so be sure to take a look!

Marlie is also home to a large colony of rabbits, plus one of our very own, our colourful mascot Loopy! Come and see us at Marlie soon (but don't forget those carrots).

For a touch of extra comfort why not explore our luxury lodges range?

The ultimate in Park Holidays UK accommodation, our range of prime location lodges offer innovative roomy design and luxurious fixtures and fittings, perfect for holiday living.

overview.short_overview: Marlie Holiday Park is a beautiful countryside park perfectly situated between the villages of New Romney and Dymchurch on Kent's south coast. Especially good for families, it's a great location for a Kent caravan holiday home, with some great facilities.
overview.long_overview:
Marlie, a country setting near the sea for your Kent Holiday Home. Marlie is just a short drive from the beach on the edge of New Romney and adjacent to the Romney Warren nature reserve, which is home to a wonderful variety of migratory birds, uncommon plants, and insects (especially dragonflies).

We are also just a short drive from the famous Romney Hythe & Dymchurch narrow gauge railway.

With the many delights of Romney on your doorstep, Marlie is a brilliantly convenient and accessible location, about 20 minutes off the M20. The surrounding area offers lots to explore, from the bustling port town of Folkestone to the golden stretches of beach at the revered Camber Sands. There's also Port Lympne Wildlife Park, the Hop Farm and the historic town of Canterbury to be discovered - inquisitive minds should never run out of things to do in this county.

At Marlie the family-friendly clubhouse has a bar with a restaurant area and a separate entertainment suite, so you can dance or dine as you choose. The new indoor pool (built-in 2020) is great for a dip after a busy day out - take a tour here, and there's a safe adventure play area for the younger family members.

Owning a holiday home at Marlie may cost less than you would imagine - we have a wide selection of static caravans for sale with affordable finance options for every budget. We invite you to come and be our guests for the day to explore the park and view the latest models for sale.

A warm welcome awaits!

blte6ce00eda7b0471a.title: Harts

overview.short_overview: A family holiday haven on Kent’s very own sunshine island.
overview.long_overview:
Harts is the perfect holiday park destination; boasting a fantastic entertainment venue and great leisure facilities, including a modern indoor pool, family bar and restaurant, arcades and an adventure playground.

It's located in Leysdown, a famous seaside resort with a fine promenade, and an award winning beach.

Leysdown has all the amenities of a traditional seaside resort but combines this with a tranquil 'back to nature' feel generated from miles of unspoiled beaches and wide open green spaces.

You may not know that Leysdown attracts over 100,000 visitors a year and has one of the lowest rainfalls in the UK? Just another great reason to visit this lovely area.

The surrounding Kent area offers a range of attractions for all the family; Howletts Wild Animal Park, Leeds Castle, Adventure Island and historic Canterbury are under an hours drive.

Stay at Harts holiday park, and you can experience the recently refurbished clubhouse and new swimming pool - there's plenty to do on and off the park, and you'll want to return again and again.

overview.short_overview: Harts Caravan Park is in the coastal town of Leysdown-on-Sea, on Kent's ever popular Isle of Sheppey. Leysdown is a great traditional seaside resort, it's a real family favourite. It's a great location for your Kent caravan holiday home!
overview.long_overview:
The Island's longest holiday season - now 10 months! Someone has let the cat out of the bag, since the bridge opened the journey from the mainland to the holiday Isle of Sheppey is quicker, and Harts Holiday park has become even more popular!

Leysdown lies at the eastern end of the Isle of Sheppey and has all the amenities of a traditional seaside resort, but combines this with a tranquil 'back to nature' feel, with miles of unspoiled beaches and wide open green spaces. You may not know that Leysdown is thriving and attracts over 100,000 visitors a year? It also has one of the lowest rainfalls in the UK which is a huge bonus.

We love Sheppey! It is everything that's great about 'bucket and spade' holiday resorts, and you won't have to 'dig deep' to be a holiday home owner here. We have a wide range of static caravans for sale to suit all budgets.

We also offer a range of flexible finance packages to assist with your holiday home purchase. To find out more, including details on holiday home running costs, get in touch today. A warm welcome awaits!
