blteb588785fbc9963d.title: Dovercourt

overview.short_overview: A wonderful park situated in a perfect location on the Essex Sunshine Coast.
overview.long_overview:
Situated close to a Blue Flag Beach, those who enjoy the seaside should pack their bucket and spade.

Beautiful rolling surf and gorgeous Essex sunshine are the norm so be sure to apply the sun cream in advance.

There’s plenty to keep families and couples content on the park with a fantastic brand new indoor heated swimming pool, adventure golf and an adventure playground to keep the kids busy, an all-weather sports court, and a small shop for those extra supplies.

On top of these fantastic facilities, we have now our entertainment venue and restaurant has been further developed in 2020, including an outdoor terraced area - take a tour here. Kitted out with the latest showbiz technology, and a high-tech lighting and sound system, it stages amazing live shows through the holiday season. Along with a new arcade, there's also a funky bar with super-size TV screens, a restaurant, a mini-supermarket, and more.

There will be plenty of reasons to get out and explore the county too. Take a stroll around the nearby town of Harwich; as well as featuring one of the country’s oldest cinemas - The Electric Palace, it’s also the location of the Redoubt Fortress, which offers glorious panoramic views of the entire area. Sightseers can also visit the Lifeboat Museum, the Halfpenny Pier, The Radio Museum, Angel Gate and the Old Treadmill Crane.

The area of Dovercourt is renowned for its civil war history, but you don’t have to be a historical boffin to enjoy a fantastic holiday break at this Essex park.

Slightly further afield we have Walton-on-the-Naze, Clacton-On-Sea, Colchester, and bustling Ipswich, all waiting to be discovered by you and your family. Plus we’re not too far from Constable County - the scenic home of John Constable and the inspiration for his many stunning paintings.

Dovercourt Holiday Park has so much to offer – so make the Essex Sunshine Coast your destination for an amazing holiday this year!

overview.short_overview: A wonderful park situated in a perfect location on the Essex Sunshine Coast.
overview.long_overview:
If you’re keen on caravanning in Essex why not visit Dovercourt Holiday park this season?

The historical nature of Dovercourt and nearby Harwich attracts visitors from all over the country. Local landmarks like one of the country’s oldest cinemas - The Electric Palace, the formidable Redoubt Fortress, the Lifeboat Museum, the Halfpenny Pier, The Radio Museum, Angel Gate and the Old Toutreadmill Crane mean those in search of culture and history should be in their element.

From the park take a short amble to the Dovercourt seafront, it’s a Blue Flag Beach, offering traditional seaside fun, and perfect for a spot of sunbathing or a refreshing dip in the briny.

Dovercourt park has all the great touring facilities you would expect and more; brand new Camping Pods, electric hard standing pitches, shower blocks, a fantastic brand new indoor swimming pool and a newly refurbished clubhouse that has been developed further in 2020 - take a tour here - with lively entertainment on selected nights, and an all-weather sports court for those feeling active.

There’s also a small shop, an adventure playground, and even a mini-golf course if you feel like perfecting your Rory Mcilroy impression.

So many great reasons to visit Dovercourt Holiday Park – we hope to see you at the park soon.

overview.short_overview: Looking for a fantastic holiday home location steeped in history and tradition? With excellent park facilities and loads to offer Dovercourt Holiday Park in Essex could be the perfect choice.
overview.long_overview:
It’s not called the "Essex Sunshine Coast" for nothing, and situated this close to an award winning Blue Flag Beach you’ll soon realize why. Long, languid summer days at the seaside are a regular for those who are lucky enough to own here, and your friends and family will soon be pestering you to invite them down to share in the sunshine.

The town of Dovercourt, and nearby Harwich offer many sites of historic interest (Civil War buffs will be in their element), and is partly why this area attracts visitors from all over the UK. Local landmarks like the Redoubt Fortress with its wonderful panoramic views of the Peninsula, the Lifeboat Museum, the Halfpenny Pier, The Radio Museum, Angel Gate and the Old Treadmill Crane will mean there’s always more to learn, and plenty more to see.

On the holiday park there’s lots to keep holiday home owners happy; the friendly clubhouse (developed further for 2020 - take a tour here), an outdoor swimming pool, an adventure playground for kids, an all-weather sports court, an amusement arcade, a small shop for essentials, and even a mini-golf course.

Owners here on the Sunshine Coast can enjoy up to a long season at Dovercourt, with a great range of Holiday Homes to suit all budgets. So why not come and see us to find out more? Take a look around, breathe in the seaside air and sense of history, and make full use of our park facilities while you are here.

A warm, sunny welcome awaits!

blt7a8ee631fb04704e.title: Steeple Bay

overview.short_overview: A stunning and tranquil location on the water’s edge, surrounded by countryside.
overview.long_overview:
Discover Steeple Bay and escape to a wonderful, waterside retreat. Situated on the coast near Southminster, the park is the hidden treasure of the South East of England, with ready access to the Mayland Creek.

If you're looking for a relaxing getaway for all the family then Steeple Bay is the right place to be. Choose to spend time in our Riverside bar or take a dip in the heated outdoor swimming pool, while the kids have fun around the park with Loopy and his friends.

Or take to the nearby waters; you don't have to be an active boatman to enjoy the location though, just watching the boats and yachts go by is the perfect therapy for todays stressful lifestyle.

The park boasts great facilities including a well-stocked fishing lake (with day tickets available from reception), an adventure playground and an amusement arcade. Along with our leisure pool there is also a paddling pool for our very youngest guests. Visit the clubhouse to round off a perfect day with tasty food and drink available, along with live music and top shows during busier periods.

The medieval town of Maldon is nearby with lots of shops and great restaurants to discover (Thursdays and Saturdays are best as they are market days). Other "must-see" Essex attractions worth jumping in the car for, include Adventure Island, Chelmsford Miniature Railway, Colchester Zoo and the famous pier at Clacton-on-Sea.

Or just revel in the majesty of the park surroundings; Steeple Bay Holiday Park sits along the banks of the Blackwater Estuary with beautiful unspoiled views across the water and, if you are lucky the sight of seals that are frequent visitors to the area. The seals love the area, and in all likelihood so will you!

highlights.subtitle: Beautiful views of the estuary

Steeple Bay is in the heart of the Essex countryside, located on the estuary of the River Blackwater, and a great spot for seasonal touring.

Steeple Bay is the hidden treasure of the South East of England, with ready access to the Mayland Creek. Choose to relax in our Riverside bar or take part in a huge mix of activities. You can take to the nearby waters, but don't have to be an active boatman to enjoy watching the boats and yachts go by; it's the perfect therapy for today's stressful lifestyle.

Our heated leisure pool is ideal for children and grown ups alike with a paddling pool for our youngest guests. Our entertainment venue will round off a perfect day with live music and shows during busier periods. The medieval town of Maldon is nearby with lots of shops and restaurants to discover. Thursdays and Saturdays are best as they are market days!

overview.short_overview: If you are looking for an accessible and beautiful holiday setting on the Essex coast, Steeple Bay Holiday Park is the perfect place for your caravan holiday home. Situated near Southminster, it's an ideal park for those who want to get away from life's hustle and bustle.
overview.long_overview:
Discover Steeple Bay and escape to a wonderful, waterside retreat. The park is situated on the coast near Southminster and offers great facilities. With ready access to the Mayland Creek, it houses its own private slipway for Boats and Jet skis.

You don't have to be an active boatman to enjoy Steeple Bay, just watching the boats and yachts go by is the perfect therapy for today's stressful lifestyle. Access to our well stocked fishing lake is also free for our holiday home owners.

Our heated leisure pool is perfect for children and grown-ups alike with a paddling pool for our youngest visitors. Our entertainment venue will round off a perfect day with live music and shows during the summer months.

The medieval town of Maldon is nearby and there are lots of shops and restaurants to discover, Thursdays and Saturdays are best as they are market days! For traditional seaside fun, you can take a trip to nearby Southend-on-Sea, home to the world’s longest pier. So if you are looking for a special place for your Essex holiday home by the coast put Steeple Bay at the top of your list! We have easy access from the M25 just off the A12 and most of our holiday home owners live under an hour drive. With holiday homes and static caravans for sale for a wide range of budgets, owning a holiday home needn't cost a fortune. So why not come and see us to find out more? Take a look at the holiday homes available and make use of all our facilities while you are here. A warm welcome awaits!

bltcc65554a13d65f24.title: Martello Beach

overview.short_overview: Set by a spectacular stretch of sandy coastline that runs for 7 miles...
overview.long_overview:
If you’re wondering how Martello Beach Holiday Park got its name, you won’t have to look too far. It’s adjacent to the gloriously sandy Martello Beach, a golden shoreline that stretches for up to 7 miles, so you should find plenty of space to build that ultimate sandcastle.

Just a 3-mile drive from the bustling, seaside resort of Clacton-on-Sea with its famous pleasure pier, Martello Beach is ideally situated for a brilliantly fun family holiday. Local attractions include Colchester Zoo, Holland Haven Country Park, and the East Anglian Railway Museum – it’s not just for trainspotters!

And with so much coastline to explore, a swim in the Essex sea can’t be recommended enough, you can dry off in style afterwards relaxing on the sand.

On the holiday park, we have indoor and outdoor (heated) swimming pools, a bar and restaurant, an adventure playground, and a sports court. Tasty food and drink is available throughout the day, and in the busy summer periods there’s fantastic events, activities, clubs and shows to entertain young and old.

Plus you are free to use the many facilities at our neighbouring sister park of St Osyth, literally a short stroll away, and Seawick.

There are so many great reasons why guests choose to return again and again, so pack your beach towels, sun cream and sunglasses, and join us at Martello Beach Holiday Park!

highlights.title: Direct beach access
highlights.subtitle: Short drive from the seaside town of Clacton-On-Sea

highlights.title: Lively entertainment programme
highlights.subtitle: The whole family will love

overview.short_overview: Set by a spectacular stretch of sandy coastline that runs for 7 miles. If you can picture calming strolls along the shore, paddles in the surf or watching the grandkids build ornate sandcastles on the beach, then this holiday park offers the beach lifestyle in abundance.
overview.long_overview:
As well as the allure of the seashore the Essex area offers lots to do; visit the bustling resort of Clacton-on-Sea, meet the animals at Colchester Zoo, look around Walton-on-the-Naze or see the beautiful scenery at Holland Haven Country Park. There’s also great areas around the park for golf, sea-fishing and even Push Kiting if you’re brave enough!

Martello Beach Holiday Park has indoor and outdoor (heated) swimming pools (in case the sea is a bit colder during the autumn months), a bar, a restaurant, an adventure playground for the kids, and a sports court. Holiday Home owners can enjoy up to an 11 months season on the park, so you can use your holiday home most of the year round.

We have a wide range of holiday homes and lodge models for all budgets at this seaside retreat. So why not come and see us to find out more? Take a look at the holiday homes available, take in the glorious coastline, and make use of our facilities whilst you are here.

A warm, sunny welcome awaits!

blt0917ebfa5088a9ed.title: Riviera Bay

overview.short_overview: Incredible sea views in Brixham on the Devon Riviera coast
overview.long_overview:
Peace, tranquillity and total relaxation.

Riviera Bay has recently been transformed, so that our guests can truly appreciate one of the most stunning locations on the British coastline, our traditional holiday chalets have been removed and replaced with luxury lodges that enjoy a spacious position amongst beautifully landscaped grounds.

The peaceful park ambience will be assured with the removal of our entertainment complex and leisure facilities to create a noise-free environment for all. Guests at Riviera Bay will receive a warm welcome at our sister park, Landscove Holiday Park should they wish to use the swimming pools, restaurant, arcades or even enjoy a game of Bingo. Landscove is just a stroll away (0.9m) next to Berry Head National nature reserve.

The setting is stunning and it’s conveniently located, there's so many places to go and attractions to visit around this magnificent Devon landscape: Kents Cavern, the Bygones Museum, Paignton Zoo, Greenway (holiday home of celebrated author “Agatha Christie”), Powderham Castle, Splashdown Water Park, and Babbacombe Model Village are just some of the local highlights, but you can easily lose hours just walking the wonderful beaches and scenic coastal paths.

Riviera Bay will only offer the very best holiday lodge accommodation available.

Our range of lodges feature innovative roomy design, luxurious fixtures and fittings, and all boast an outside decking area, complete with garden furniture so our guests can take in the stunning scenery.

For the ultimate relaxation holiday or short break, please join us at Riviera Bay soon.

Please note that Riviera Bay occupies a stunning cliff top location with lovely views over St Mary's Bay. A pebbly beach is accessible from the park via a coastal path however the gradient is steep and not suitable for the elderly or infirm.

highlights.title: Coastal location
highlights.subtitle: Spectacular views over St Mary’s Bay

highlights.title: South Devon
highlights.subtitle: Discover many attractions

highlights.title: Serene, restful atmosphere
highlights.subtitle: Glorious park setting

overview.short_overview: The Bay is an exclusive luxury lodge development situated on the edge of Riviera Bay Holiday Park in Brixham with amazing views out to sea.
overview.long_overview:
Come and visit Riviera Bay's beautiful Luxury Lodge Development!

Experience stunning Devon coast views from your lodge holiday home set in one of the most jaw-dropping locations in South Devon; perched near the cliff tops of St Mary's Bay, the park enjoys spectacular views across the bay and out to sea.

Riviera Bay is a peaceful park perfect for those wanting to get away from it all in a relaxing environment. Holiday Home owners at Riviera Bay are free to make use of our sister park, Landscove Holiday Park (conveniently located just a short stroll away) and its many facilities: swimming pools, restaurant, arcades or occasional entertainment featured during the holiday season.

At Riviera Bay you can enjoy direct access to the beautiful secluded coastline below from the Devon coastal footpath which runs alongside, and to the Berryhead nature reserve and country park close by. This park is set in one of the most exclusive areas of Brixham, just a short drive from the town centre and picturesque harbour. It's a great base to explore all that the English Riviera can offer, including Torquay, Paignton and further afield.

You also have the option of letting out your holiday home when you are not using it, a valuable additional source of income - we can look after all the hassle for you (full details are available on request).

So why not visit Riviera Bay today to find out more?

blt82c490c47edee1bd.title: Hedley Wood

overview.short_overview: A hidden gem of a holiday park on the Devon Cornwall border
overview.long_overview:
Enjoy the best of coast and country at Hedley Wood.

Located on the border between Devon and Cornwall, just a few miles from award-winning coastal resort Bude, this park gives holidaymakers the opportunity to enjoy one of the South West’s most picturesque regions, defined by dramatic coastlines, breathtaking landscapes and idyllic locales.

Hedley Wood is perfect for anyone seeking fresh air, new experiences and quiet escapes into Devon and Cornwall – Dartmoor, Bodmin and the Tarka Trail are just a few of the attractions within easy reach.

On park, there’s plenty to keep you entertained, too. You’ll find amenities including the Woodman bar, shop, nature trails, children’s play area, shop, launderette and shower facilities, plus plenty of open space.

It’s pet friendly, too, with plenty of dog-friendly coastal paths and beaches nearby – many of which welcome dogs on leads, even in the high season.

And, for those looking to take the strain out of camping, three grades of glamping accommodation are available, including two-storey Safari lodges (some with hot tubs) and tents.

With its spectacular landscapes, picture-perfect resorts and wide, sandy beaches, it’s easy to see why this region has been a popular holiday destination for generations – and Hedley Wood is one of the best ways to experience it.

highlights.subtitle: Dartmoor, Bodmin and the Tarka Trail

Located just a few miles from award-winning coastal resort Bude, Hedley Wood offers you an opportunity to enjoy one of the South West’s most captivating regions, full of dramatic coastlines, breathtaking landscapes and idyllic locales.

It’s perfect for quiet escapes into Devon and Cornwall – Dartmoor, Bodmin and the Tarka Trail are just a few of the attractions within easy reach – and it’s pet friendly, too.

On park, you’ll find amenities including the Woodman bar, shop, nature trails, children’s play area, shop, launderette and shower facilities, plus plenty of open space.

Easy to reach, and so close to spectacular landscapes, picture-perfect resorts and wide, sandy beaches, it’s no wonder Hedley Wood is such a popular choice for touring caravan holidays.

overview.short_overview: Discover the best of coast and country at Hedley Wood, on the Devon-Cornwall border. Just a few miles from the award winning coastal resort of Bude, here you can explore one of the South West’s most picturesque regions.
overview.long_overview:
Located in 52 acres of scenic countryside, Hedley Wood Holiday Park is the perfect location to own a holiday home if you enjoy the great outdoors, whether that’s relaxing from the comfort of your own decking with a good book or walking, cycling, or playing golf nearby.

If you can’t decide between Cornwall and Devon as the ideal county to own a caravan holiday home or lodge then Hedley Wood could be right for you; officially in Devon but just a few yards from the park entrance and you’re in Cornwall and only 5 miles from the seaside resort of Bude.

Of course we do have all the amenities you could want from a holiday park including a popular bar and occasional entertainment in the evening. We also have a shop for the necessities and a laundrette.

If your pet is an important factor when choosing the perfect park to purchase a holiday caravan or lodge then Hedley Wood must be at the top of your shortlist. With acres of space including dedicated dog-walking trails, you don’t even need to leave the park to enjoy quality time with your pet. We even have special pet showers – perfect after a hard day playing!

Owning a holiday home on the Devon & Cornwall border at Hedley Wood Holiday Park could soon become a reality. We have a large range of makes and models to suit most budgets and you can also enjoy a valuable extra income with our popular, easy to understand letting scheme when you are not using it.

Why not come and visit to find out more? Be our guests for the day and enjoy all the park facilities, a warm welcome awaits. On your visit, you’ll be able to view the latest range of caravan holiday homes and lodges for sale.

blt8665cd1dfc554297.title: Golden Sands

overview.short_overview: A Devon holiday with top class entertainment and a superb indoor & outdoor pool.
overview.long_overview:
With all the features you would expect (and more) from a top quality holiday park, you’ll never be short of something to do at Golden Sands.

South Devon is an amazing location to visit with plenty to see and do, from beautiful sandy beaches to fantastic family attractions.

Park Holidays UK has 2 holiday parks in Dawlish Warren (we just love the area)! What's more, our guests can enjoy the facilities of each park - that's three swimming pools and two fantastic clubhouses all within walking distance!

Golden Sands is an ideal holiday destination in a wonderful Devon hotspot, and the atmosphere on park is always very friendly. We have a reputation for providing some of the best holiday park entertainment around, and you can enjoy top class shows on most nights, in fact that's one of the main reasons so many guests come back year after year!

With Loopy Club, an adventure playground, and a designated play area for the under 5's there's plenty to keep the kids happy too.

If you're looking to catch the perfect tan, then beautiful Dawlish Warren beach is close to hand, and offers miles of sandy paradise and rolling waves. The seaside fun includes children's rides, fantastic shopping areas, Go-Karting, Mini (and actual) golf courses, and a host of cafes and bars.

And you can discover the many delights of South Devon's spectacular scenery, with lots of amazing places to visit for days out.

So what are you waiting for? Visit Golden Sands today for your perfect Devon family holiday.

highlights.subtitle: In the superb seaside town of Dawlish Warren

highlights.title: Jam-packed entertainment

overview.short_overview: Great facilities in Dawlish, Devon - not far from the Dawlish Warren beach
overview.long_overview:
Choose Golden Sands for a Devon break with top-class entertainment and a great range of facilities. South Devon is an ideal location to visit for a camping holiday with plenty to see and do. Our casual camping site is ideal for short stays and can be hilly in places.

We also offer Camping Pods - a unique way to holiday.

Keen to experience Devon's traditional seaside fun? There are children's rides, shopping areas, Go-Karting, Mini (and actual) golf courses, and a host of cafes and bars.

We also have a reputation for providing some of the best holiday park entertainment around, and you can enjoy fun and lively shows on most nights - all in the price! In fact that's one of the main reasons so many guests come back year after year.

With so much to see and do around the local area, you’ll never be short of something to do in this perfect Devon location.

overview.short_overview: Golden Sands Holiday Park is one of our most popular parks for holiday home ownership. Its perfect location close to the beach on a gentle slope in Dawlish Warren with views out to sea is enhanced by its great facilities and first class entertainment.
overview.long_overview:
People choose holiday home ownership at Golden Sands for many reasons, but everyone loves the perfect location close to the beach, with spectacular views out to sea. Excellent facilities and family fun entertainment also help to make this the quintessential Devon holiday park.

South Devon's amazing scenery is a given here, but as a holiday home owner at Golden Sands you can also enjoy two times the fun, with a choice of facilities across both our parks in Dawlish (Dawlish Sands Holiday Park is under a 10 minute walk).

Golden Sands itself has great facilities and the atmosphere is very friendly, with a strong focus on our personal service. You can make use of the indoor & outdoor pools plus there's our fantastic entertainment complex which features our well known show team and other acts during the holiday season (though it's equally ideal for a quiet drink).

There's also an adventure playground, an amusement arcade, a sun terrace, and a fishing lake, so there's something for everyone to enjoy.

Owning a Devon holiday home at Golden Sands may be more affordable than you think, with a huge range of models available for all budgets. You can also enjoy a valuable extra income with our subletting scheme when you are not using it - or you can keep it all to yourself, the choice is yours!

Why not come and visit to find out more? Be our guests for the day and enjoy all the park facilities, a warm welcome awaits.

overview.short_overview: A quiet, peaceful retreat in the rolling hills of Malvern, offering the best of countryside holidays. Our cottages are ideal for a tranquil break or an adventurous family getaway. With plenty to see on and off-park, you're sure to find something to suit the whole family all year round.
overview.long_overview:
Located on the border between Worcestershire and Herefordshire, Malvern View is the perfect spot to break away from the hustle and bustle of daily life. Resting in over 100 acres of magnificent farmland with walking trails that lead to stunning views of the local area, it is a haven for anyone that loves the countryside and provides the ideal place to relax and unwind.

On-park, you can also enjoy the use of three freshwater fishing lakes and our very own ‘Deer Reserve,’ home to over 30 red deer with viewing platforms and feeding bays, making a wonderful experience for the whole family. Away from the park, more trails take you through Areas of Outstanding Natural Beauty, while close links to market towns and villages mean you’ll never be far from local indulgences.

Choose from five charming countryside cottages that offer perfect accommodation on your holiday to the Malvern Hills. With a range of 1 and 2 bedrooms, and even hot tubs available too! Or if you want to embrace the outdoors, why not try our seasonal Safari Tents, offering the perfect glamping experience for the whole family.

highlights.subtitle: The breathtaking Malvern Hills on your doorstep

highlights.title: Tranquil ornamental fishing lakes

highlights.subtitle: Our on-park experience with handling bays and feeding trays

overview.short_overview: Sitting on the North Coast of Cornwall, Pentire is perfectly located for exploring both Cornwall and Devon, with lovely views of both the surrounding coast and countryside.
overview.long_overview:
Situated within a short distance of the popular seaside town of Bude, Pentire is close to a choice of beautiful beaches, historic market towns, and cosy Cornish pubs and restaurants, serving some of the best local seafood. On-park, you can relish in the peaceful surroundings, children can find fun in the adventure play park and dog owners can enjoy the on-park dog walking field where their four-legged friends can stretch their legs. The local area boasts an incredible variety of attractions and entertainment options along with many traditionally Cornish quaint towns to discover including Port Isaac and Boscastle just a short distance away from the park.

With a wide range of spacious holiday homes and lodges for you and your family to choose from, along with our brand-new Glamping Pods, Pentire offers a range of accommodations so you can find the right one tailored to you.

With plenty to see and do in North Yorkshire, and perfectly located with far-reaching countryside views and within easy access to all of the hotspots in the Yorkshire Dales, you’ll never be short of things to do.

overview.short_overview: Nestled just behind the sand dunes of Par Beach, Par Sands places you a stone’s throw from the unspoiled, immaculate beaches of Cornwall.
overview.long_overview:
With its mild climate, golden beaches and ancient heritage, Par Sands is nestled just behind the sand dunes of the dog-friendly Par Beach and a stone’s throw from the water’s edge, boasting an unrivalled, peaceful location yet is close to the many exciting attractions that South Cornwall has to offer. Explore the unspoiled scenery and local treasures at your leisure, or stroll along the stunning nearby beaches. What’s more, the globally-renowned biomes of the Eden Project are just a short journey away and make for an incredible family day out. Our fantastic on-park facilities ensure you and your family will always be entertained; our indoor swimming pool, all-weather sports courts, adventure playground, inviting café and wildlife lake are all perfect ways to relax and unwind.

With a wide range of spacious holiday homes and lodges for you and your family to choose from, at Par Sands you can find the right accommodation tailored to you.

overview.short_overview: Perfectly placed in an Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty, our Brynteg Country & Leisure Retreat offers stunning views of Snowdonia and the surrounding countryside of North Wales.
overview.long_overview:
Nestled in the foothills of Snowdon with its own private lake, Brynteg offers majestic mountain ranges, stunning beaches, and charming countryside. Whether it’s exploring castles in Caernarfon, soaking up history in Llanberis, or relaxing on Anglesey’s 250 miles of coastline, it’s easy to see why people escape here time after time. For those who enjoy a more leisurely pace of life, indulge in the on-park facilities including an indoor pool, gym, restaurant, and bar.

With an expansive range of spacious holiday homes and lodges for you and your family to choose from and a charming lakeside cottage with its own private garden and hot tub, Brynteg offers a range of accommodations so you can find the right one tailored to you.

blt1e126462cc40c2ff.title: Trevella

overview.short_overview: A very popular holiday park situated in the most beautiful position near Newquay
overview.long_overview:
Set in an enviable location close to picturesque Crantock, Newquay and the rest of Cornwall’s north coast, Trevella Park is one of the popular county’s shining stars.

For anyone looking to get back to nature, Travella Park boasts beautiful views, rolling hills, and one of Cornwall’s best beaches just a stone's throw away, complete with golden sands and rolling waves.

Trevella Park offers holidaymakers a wealth of accommodation ranging from caravans and lodges to glamping, including Safari Lodges, Geo Domes and Safari Tents – plus on-site facilities including fishing lakes, adventure playground, heated outdoor swimming pool and crazy golf, with plenty of space to explore.

If you’re feeling adventurous, strike out and sample Cornwall’s many attractions, from the Eden Project, Newquay Zoo and the Lost Gardens of Heligan to the picturesque Padstow, Tintagel and Port Isaac – home to many of TV’s most popular shows.

This TripAdvisor award-winning holiday park is among the county’s most popular, attracting rave reviews and giving guests unbeatable experiences that keep them coming back, year after year.

Want to make magical holiday memories that will last a lifetime? Trevella Park is the place for you.

overview.short_overview: A fun-filled holiday park situated in the most enviable position near Newquay
overview.long_overview:
Close to picturesque Crantock, Newquay and Cornwall’s bewitching north coast, Trevella Park is one of the county’s most popular resorts, boasting breathtaking views, rolling hills, and one of Cornwall’s best beaches, complete with golden sands and rolling waves.

Trevella Park offers touring holidaymakers everything from simple pitches to comprehensive ensuite facilities, plus on-site attractions including fishing lakes, an adventure playground, heated outdoor swimming pool and crazy golf, plus plenty of space for the whole family to explore.

It also puts Cornwall’s many attractions within reach – from the Eden Project and the Lost Gardens of Heligan to the picturesque Tintagel and Port Isaac.

This TripAdvisor award-winning holiday park is one of the county’s most popular, attracting rave reviews and giving guests unbeatable experiences that keep them returning, year after year.

For an unforgettable, unique and thoroughly enjoyable taste of Cornwall, look no further than Trevella Park.

overview.short_overview: The popular North Coast of Cornwall is a perfect place to own your new Holiday Home. Trevella Holiday Park is located close to Crantock Beach and Newquay, allowing you to enjoy all the pleasures of this beautiful region.
overview.long_overview:
There are few places you would rather be than on the north coast of Cornwall and just moments from some of Britain’s finest beaches. Trevella Holiday Park allows you to unwind and enjoy the relaxing atmosphere of the park but you are also just a short drive from Newquay and its many attractions.

We have a great selection of caravan holiday homes and lodges for sale.

Holiday home ownership at Trevella gives you the perfect weekend bolt-hole or you can stay for much longer if you prefer. From the moment you arrive at the park, the stresses of every day life will melt away as you soak up the holiday vibe – all year round.

Location, location, location! They say it’s the most important aspect of any type of home and it couldn’t be truer than here. Facilities are focused on outdoor living with carefully planned play areas for our youngest guests and a lovely outdoor pool for cooling off on those hot summer days. You won’t find amusement arcades or large entertainment venues at Trevella – life here is a little more relaxed. You will however find one of the smallest pubs in the country if you do want to enjoy a drink with friends or family. The Piskie Inn can accommodate up to 8-10 people. We also offer a convenient mini-market for those everyday essentials and a launderette if you stay a little longer than planned (it happens quite often!)

Owning a holiday home in Cornwall at Trevella Holiday Park may be more affordable than you think, with a huge range of models available for all budgets. You can also enjoy a valuable extra income with our letting scheme when you are not using it - or you can keep it all to yourself, the choice is yours!

Why not come and visit to find out more? Be our guests for the day and enjoy all the park facilities, a warm welcome awaits. On your visit you’ll be able to view the latest range of caravan holiday homes and lodges for sale.

highlights.title: Perfect location in Crantock near Newquay
Easy access to some of Cornwall's finest beaches
Friendly, relaxing park with a lovely outdoor swimming pool

bltf2b6d65b521eb72f.title: Wood Farm

overview.short_overview: The perfect location for your UK holiday on the west Dorset coast.
overview.long_overview:
New to Park Holidays UK – Set amongst mature native trees and pristine rolling Dorset countryside, Wood Farm is the perfect place to get away from it all.

Nestled in the Char Valley, in an area of outstanding natural beauty less than a mile from Charmouth beach and the timeless Jurassic Coast, Wood Farm is one of Park Holidays UK’s most natural locations.

With its stunning fishing lake, wide-open spaces, and indoor heated swimming pool, Wood Farm offers something for everyone. Relax and take in the magnificent rural scenery, strike out on walking routes along stunning coastal paths and rolling inland countryside, or take the time to explore the region’s ancient hill forts, historic houses, and tranquil villages.

Why not go fossil hunting along the rugged coastline, or enjoy the charms of nearby seaside town Lyme Regis, with its ancient harbour and quirky mix of upmarket fish restaurants and fast-food stalls?

With a small bar, tennis court, shop and playground – Wood Farm offers the perfect getaway for the whole family.

overview.short_overview: The perfect location for your UK holiday on the west Dorset coast.
overview.long_overview:
Nestled in the Char Valley, in an area of outstanding natural beauty less than a mile from Charmouth beach and the world-renowned Jurassic Coast, Wood Farm offers holidaymakers an unspoilt haven of tranquillity at the border of Dorset, Devon, and Somerset.

The perfect caravan and camping park for anyone wishing to escape the everyday, Wood Farm offers pitches for caravans and motorhomes alike, with spectacular views over Lyme Bay and the Marshwood Vale.

It’s the perfect base for anyone seeking to explore Lyme Regis, plus the nearby rolling countryside and timeless villages.

Back on the park, all our touring and motor caravan pitches have individual all-weather hardstandings, electric hook-ups, and provision for awnings. We also offer premium pitches with their own individual water hook-ups and grey waste drainage points.

There’s a great range of facilities for the whole family, including a heated indoor swimming pool, tennis court, gym, shop, and adventure playground – plus the park’s very own family fishing lake.

There’s something for everyone at Wood Farm!

As far as unspoilt natural surroundings go, it’s hard to beat Wood Farm. Situated in the entrancing Dorset countryside, and just a stone’s throw from glorious pebble beaches, this exceptional park offers the opportunity to truly get away from it all.

Wood Farm is nestled in the Char Valley, and is one of Park Holidays UK’s most idyllic settings.

Whether you’re looking for captivating sea views, quirky village escapes or a slice of history, Wood Farm offers the perfect base from which to investigate the seaside town of Lyme Regis, hunt for fossils along the Jurassic Coast, or take a walk along the area’s stunning coastal paths.

And don’t forget the on-park amenities – from an indoor heated pool to a private fishing lake, there’s plenty to keep you occupied at Wood Farm, making it one of our most sought-after locations.

blt464eabc53119e9eb.title: West Mersea

overview.short_overview: Mersea Island, a perfect combination of rich scenery and wonderful coastline.
overview.long_overview:
Located on the beautiful West Mersea Beach and within easy reach of the town centre, this Essex park offers a strong mix of relaxation, holiday atmosphere, and remarkable coastline views*.

A small and quiet place to relax, the park is close to the Blackwater Estuary, a large section of which is a triple SSSI (Site of Special Scientific Interest). The inspiring sights will thrill nature lovers, featuring flocks of migrating seabirds, along with a host of wonderful wildlife and flora.

Mersea Island is rightly celebrated for its water sports; Boat lovers and Sailing fanatics, Windsurfers and Kitesurfers will be in their element here. Fishing is also a famous tradition of the Island, a wide variety of tasty fish are regularly caught (sole, skate, bass, mullet, herring and cod) and sold in the specialist restaurants nearby. The area is also revered for its magnificent native Oysters, a delicacy that every touring guest should try!

The surrounding Essex countryside is lots of fun to explore. Why not visit historic Colchester with its many landmarks and world-famous zoo? Or walk the promenade at Clacton-on-Sea, a traditional and authentic seaside hot spot? Essex is also renowned for glorious sunny weather – it’s not called “The Sunshine Coast” for nothing!

Touring pitches are situated adjacent to our famous beach cabins and sandy beach, available on all-weather hard standing with electric, water and free showers**.

Spend your evenings in our brand new and restaurant and bar – The Sandbank, with visiting cabaret acts and appetizing food and drink. West Mersea Holiday Park also benefits from a shop and laundrette.

We also have charming, coloured beach huts along the seafront, a wonderful backdrop to this incredible holiday park.

*Please note: The island can be cut off twice a day by tides. Crossing depends on the high tide levels and times can vary quite considerably. On very high tides this can isolate the island for up to 2 hours.

**The touring field at West Mersea Holiday Park has no immediate facilities. The nearest toilets and services are approximately a 5-10 minute walk away.

overview.short_overview: This wonderful island retreat is the perfect spot for your Holiday Home by the Essex coast.
overview.long_overview:
West Mersea Holiday Park is fantastically located directly on the highly desirable West Mersea Beach, and within easy reach of the town centre.

One of our smaller, quieter parks where it is all about the location, it's a perfect place to unwind whilst taking in the beautiful scenery.

The facilities enhance the relaxed and informal atmosphere on this delightful Essex park; a cosy family bar and entertainment venue is complemented with a traditional seaside café, ideal for a cup of tea and slice of cake, with a stroll along the seafront afterwards.

From our beach, owners and their guests can enjoy views of the nearby Blackwater Estuary (a Site of Special Scientific Interest) and this area of coastline is renowned for its rich fishing, and regular hauls of fresh oysters! Seafood-loving palettes are perfectly catered for by the range of specialist restaurants nearby.

Watersports fans will also be in their element. The nearby sea and breezy conditions are perfect for sailing and boating, windsurfing and kite surfing. The seafront is lined by colourful beach huts, a scenic backdrop to a picturesque coastline stroll.

The surrounding Essex area promises plenty of gems to uncover. Visit the historic market town of Colchester (the first Roman-founded city in England) with its multitude of famous landmarks or view the many species of animal at the award-winning zoo. Clacton-on-Sea is also close by, and for a traditional old-school seaside day out it’s impossible to beat! Don’t worry too much about bringing an umbrella either, Essex is one of the driest counties in the UK – it’s not labelled “The Sunshine Coast” for nothing!
West Mersea Holiday Park is ideal for those looking for a peaceful getaway, where you can enjoy all the finer things in life within a friendly community.

We have a wide range of holiday homes and lodge models for all budgets at this island retreat, so why not come along and find out more? Take a look at the holiday homes available, take in the sights, and make full use of our facilities while you are here. A warm, sunny Essex welcome awaits!

highlights.title: Set in a wonderful island location surrounded by breath-taking scenery
Just a stone’s throw away from a beautiful sandy beach
Perfect setting for fishing, watersports, boating and sailing

blt01facf8fa763323e.title: Tarka

overview.short_overview: Set in 10 acres of well-maintained grounds and surrounded by rural countryside.
overview.long_overview:
Located less than 5 miles away from the largest town in North Devon, Barnstaple, Tarka Holiday Park is ideally situated for a relaxing, laid-back visit.

Tarka has no clubhouse, swimming pool or restaurant, but what it does have is a unique atmosphere of serenity and seclusion, perfect for discerning holiday guests where peace and tranquility is pretty high on the holiday wish list. Nestled in its beautiful natural setting, Tarka is the perfect antidote to the everyday stresses of modern life.

Tarka Holiday Park puts you in reach of the many activities and stunning locations North Devon is renowned for; from the golden beaches of Saunton, Croyde, Putsborough, Woolacombe and Instow, to the 180 miles of coastal paths, riversides and magnificent views.

Why not walk or cycle the famous Tarka Trail during your visit? Inspired by Henry Williamson’s famous fictional novel, it follows the route taken by "Tarka the Otter" in the book of the same name. The Trail takes you through wonderful Devon scenery, with rich green countryside, wooded river valleys, craggy moorland, and dramatic coastline.

As mentioned Barnstaple is also on our doorstep, and you could spend an entire day visiting the shops, cafés and other attractions; the Pannier Market and the Museum of Barnstaple and North Devon are particular favourites for holiday guests.

So if stunning scenery is your interest you’ll be spoilt for choice, from the dramatic Jurassic coastline to the north or the open moorland of Exmoor to the east, all no more than a half hour drive away.

Book your North Devon break today!

blt52e68df7654a01cf.title: Seawick

overview.short_overview: A lively park with great facilities, a brilliant entertainment venue and pool.
overview.long_overview:
Seawick Holiday Park is the perfect location for fun-filled family holidays near Clacton.

Our entertainment complex (built just a few years ago) can accommodate up to 400 holiday guests, and features a state of the art sound system and stage for our cabaret shows and other lively acts.

There's also the reception area, mini-supermarket and fun arcade area to enjoy during your stay. Our restaurant is a fantastic place for tasty food, with a great view of the stage.

Outside, a patio area hosts barbecues, super-size TV screens, seating and tables, and access to Seawick's heated outdoor swimming pool. On park we also have an adventure playground, a football pitch and a Crazy Golf course. You can enjoy even more facilities, including an indoor pool complex, at our sister parks Martello Beach and St Osyth just over the road.

The famous seaside resort of Clacton-on-Sea is nearby where you can enjoy all the fun of the fair on the pier; traditional donkey rides, ten pin bowling, the Seaquarium, and much more. For a more cultured day out chose Colchester Castle Museum or the East Anglian Rail Museum. Or head to the wonderful Colchester Zoo with its many exotic animals and birds.

With a great mix of facilities, entertainment for all ages and lots to see and do in the surrounding area, Seawick is the place to be this holiday season!

blt5e5eeca71c251a93.title: Seaview

overview.short_overview: A great park in a stunning seafront location on the north Kent coast.
overview.long_overview:
This park is located right on the beach between the popular seaside resorts of Whitstable and Herne Bay. With only the promenade separating the park from the sea, there is easy access to miles of coastal paths and beachfront to enjoy.

The park's facilities are centred around the entertainment complex with exciting shows and activities most nights. The surrounding location is ideal for sailing and water-sports enthusiasts, or if you prefer to stay on park we have a modern and heated outdoor leisure pool to relax in.

With so many places to visit in the local area, you will probably want to spend most days touring "The Garden of England"; famous castles, fishing ports, and dramatic coastal scenery are all within a short drive from Seaview.

The nearest city is Canterbury, complete with its magnificent medieval cathedral, stunning architecture and famous buildings. It also plays hosts to a huge selection of special events and festivals throughout the year including art exhibitions, live music and theatre productions.

A great park in a stunning seafront location on the north Kent coast, Seaview is perfect for creating holiday memories, and a place that you will want to visit again and again.

For a touch of extra comfort why not explore our luxury lodges range?

The ultimate in Park Holidays UK accommodation, our range of prime location lodges offer innovative roomy design and luxurious fixtures and fittings, perfect for holiday living.

Seaview is in a prime, beach front location between the popular seaside resorts of Whitstable and Herne Bay, and is perfect for camping and caravanning visitors.

Alternatively you could leave the motorhome or tent at home and try something a little different: our Camping Pods offer a unique and fun holiday experience.

The park's facilities are centered around the main entertainment complex but with so many great places to visit around the park, you will probably want to spend most days touring the "Garden of England" (as Kent is affectionately known).

Nearby Whitstable is steeped in maritime history and famous for its traditional charms and oysters! Famous castles, fishing ports, cathedral cities and dramatic coastal scenery are all within a short drive from Seaview.

Back on the park in the evening, join us for a warm welcome in the bar or a tasty supper in our cafe. This will set you up for the brilliant entertainment, which is extra special at weekends and during the summer season.

overview.long_overview:
Your Kent holiday home on the coast between Whitstable and Herne Bay. Seaview enjoys an idyllic setting right by the beach on the north Kent coast just outside Whitstable.

With access to miles of coastal footpaths leading to Whitstable and Herne Bay (or further if you want) it's a great base to explore the Kent coastline.

With our own boat storage and slipway, it's a boat owner's dream. And for the many people that prefer to watch rather than venture on (or in) to the water, that's okay too!

It's a great location to explore inland as well. Famous castles, fishing ports, cathedral cities and dramatic coastal scenery are all within a short drive from Seaview.

The park's facilities are centred around the well-appointed clubhouse and the lido-style swimming pool. In the evening, expect a warm welcome in the bar, where you can sit back and enjoy the regular entertainment or relax for a quiet drink with friends.

Our Kent holiday homes at Seaview are available for a wide range of budgets, with selected pitches now available up to 11 months of the year. Why not come down and spend a few hours with us, or even try a short break VIP visit? Be our guests and enjoy all the park facilities, a warm welcome awaits!

blt1c59caa8d07fd934.title: St Osyth Beach

overview.short_overview: A popular park close to the beach with something for everyone.
overview.long_overview:
St Osyth Beach Holiday park near Clacton-on-Sea - a breath of fresh, salty air on the Essex coast.

As its name suggests St Osyth Beach enjoys an amazing beach front location. Guest can pack a beach bag, and simply stroll from the park for direct access to miles of beautiful sandy beaches.

With an excellent range of facilities including a heated indoor swimming pool, a freshwater fishing lake, an attractive entertainment venue, and Kid's Club, this is the ideal choice for people holidaying in Essex. Holiday guests at St Osyth Beach are also welcome to use the many facilities at the neighbouring parks of Martello Beach and Seawick.

The nearby resort of Clacton-on-Sea is very fashionable, as more people decide to take their holidays in England, and flock to the traditional seaside resorts. Clacton's entertainment centres around its famous pier but there are also 2 theatres and a huge programme of entertainment throughout the summer, including the legendary Air Show.

Other Essex attraction highlights include Colchester Zoo, Colchester Castle Museum, and the East Anglian Railway Museum, or if you are up for a drive, Adventure Island at Southend-on-Sea or Promenade Park in Maldon, all sure to result in unique, everlasting memories.

So why not relax and soak up the rays at St Osyth Beach this holiday season?

More information on Fishing at St Osyth Holiday Park.

overview.short_overview: St Osyth Beach has a great location right by the Essex coast just a few miles from Clacton. With some great facilities to enjoy, the whole family can relax and soak up the fun! With a caravan holiday home at St Osyth Beach you can also enjoy all the facilities of our sister park Seawick just over the road.
overview.long_overview:
Welcome to St Osyth Beach, a park where you can enjoy the very best of both worlds, a fantastic seaside location plus some great onsite park facilities.

Invigorating sea air, amazing views, and just a short drive into Clacton, this location is perfect for those who love the beach. Clacton's entertainment centres around its famous pier - plus there are also two theatres and a big programme of entertainment throughout the summer, including the famous air show. Clacton is the traditional English seaside holiday resort at its best!

On park the large indoor heated swimming pool comes complete with a shallow area for younger children, but never seems to be overcrowded. The entertainment venue has a real family feel to it and you're never far away from the stage for the live shows which feature at weekends, and during the summer season. You can also enjoy all the facilities of our sister parks Martello Beach next door, and Seawick just over the road.

We have a range of makes and models to suit most budgets and you can also enjoy a valuable extra income with our popular, easy to understand letting scheme when you are not using it.

Why not come and visit to find out more? Be our guests for the day and enjoy all the park facilities, a warm welcome awaits. On your visit you’ll be able to view the latest range of caravan holiday homes and lodges for sale.

blt02b0408df38d25d9.title: Solent Breezes

overview.short_overview: Stunning location with magnificent views across the Solent to the Isle of Wight.
overview.long_overview:
If you like relaxing by the sea and watching the boats and ships sail by, then you’ll love Solent Breezes Holiday Park. "Small and friendly" perfectly describes Solent Breezes, and you will receive a very warm and enthusiastic welcome from our holiday team.

Visit our clubhouse which has been extensively redeveloped in 2020 - take a tour here; great value food can be enjoyed on our sun terrace while taking in the magnificent ocean views across to the Isle of Wight.

Solent Breezes is ideal for lazy days in the sun, but should you prefer, the more energetic can enjoy a game of tennis, followed by a refreshing dip in our heated outdoor pool. For entertainment we have regular cabarets and live bands performing twice a week, with a livelier programme during the summer tour season.

There's also lots to see and do in the local area including the Norman town of Winchester, and popular attraction of Port Solent, both only a scenic drive away.

Venture a little further afield to explore the Portsmouth Historic Dockland which houses a number of fascinating maritime museums and the famous warship HMS Victory, or take in the fabulous views from the Emirates Spinnaker Tower (at 170 metres high!).

Paultons Family Theme Park is another "must visit" - for young fans of a certain peppery pig family it's more fun than jumping in muddy puddles!

We may only offer one park in Hampshire, but it's certainly one of the best around. Solent Breezes - why not visit this holiday season?

overview.short_overview: Solent Breezes, situated on the edge of The Solent, has breathtaking views across to the Isle of Wight. Located on the water at Warsash opposite Cowes on the Isle of Wight, Solent Breezes is the perfect park for sailing enthusiasts!
overview.long_overview:
Where the countryside meets the seaside, here at Solent Breezes you can enjoy the best of both worlds. Located on the water at Warsash, Solent offers an ideal park location for sailing enthusiasts, fisherman, or watersports fanatics who enjoy a relaxed environment.

We are also one of the only parks that have the added luxury of a boat storage and slipway, a reason many choose Solent Breezes over anywhere else!

Solent Breezes is perfect for lazy days in the sun, whether it’s enjoying a glass of wine on our sun-terrace while watching the cruise liners sailing off into the sunset or taking a relaxing walk with the dog along the coast. The choice is yours.

Other park facilities include a heated outdoor swimming pool, a clubhouse that has been extensively redeveloped for 2020 (with sun-terrace) - take a tour here, a tennis court, and an adventure playground for the kids. For entertainment we have regular cabarets and live bands performing twice a week, with a livelier programme during the summer tour season.

"Small and friendly" describes Solent Breezes, and you will receive a very warm welcome from our park team. You’re more than just a number here, and we can guarantee you’ll make new friends for life with other like-minded owners.

We have a selection of stunning holiday homes for sale, both new and pre-loved for a whole range of budgets. If something a bit special is your preference, we also have some mind-blowing luxury Villas and Lodges which really must be seen to be believed.

So come and find out if joining us here at Solent Breezes is for you - why not arrange a visit to the park? You'll receive the warmest welcome from our team, who will guide you around the park, explain all the ins and outs, and help you to find your dream holiday home. Change your lifestyle today.

We hope to see you on park soon!

blt84ce8c75313d88ec.title: Sandhills

overview.short_overview: Set in a highly enviable beach location with views over the Solent.
overview.long_overview:
A warm welcome, amazing location and so much to see and do at Sandhills. A relaxing park, set amongst the trees right on the beach in Christchurch, and enjoying panoramic views over the English Channel.

Just a promenade separates the park from the beach so don't forget your bucket and spade. Enjoy days out in the Dorset countryside, and see why it’s an "Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty", discovering charming market towns each with their own individual history to tell.

Sandhills is a smaller, more leisurely park and is perfect for those looking to escape the hustle and bustle of everyday life. Spend time at the beautiful outdoor swimming pool, or quench your thirst in our small (but perfectly formed) bar area.

Venture into historic Christchurch or travel along the coast a short way to Bournemouth for the very best in shopping, restaurants and a beach voted the best in the UK (in 2019 on Tripadvisor).

There are some great attractions such as 'Adventure Wonderland' and 'Wild Thing' for the younger guests and even a state-of-the-art artificial ski centre for the more energetic. More people come back to Sandhills than any other park, and its easy to see why.

For a touch of extra comfort why not explore our luxury lodges range?

The ultimate in Park Holidays UK accommodation, our range of prime location lodges offer innovative roomy design and luxurious fixtures and fittings, perfect for holiday living.

We also have a fantastic range of luxury apartments now available to book.

highlights.subtitle: Right on the beach in Christchurch

highlights.title: Explore Dorset
highlights.subtitle: Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty

overview.short_overview: There's so much to see and do in Dorset with its great beaches and a host of visitor attractions. The famous seaside resort of Bournemouth boasts an array of gardens, modern shops, fine restaurants and historic piers.
overview.long_overview:
Sandhills - could you ever imagine a more perfect setting? Located with views over both Christchurch harbour and the English channel towards the Isle of Wight there is a delightfully nautical feel to this Dorset park.

Just a promenade separates Sandhills from the beach, and a short walk will take you to the boat-launching and mooring facilities of Mudeford Quay. Your holiday home could enjoy this very special view, though we can only release a few sea view pitches each year - so be quick as there is usually a waiting list!

But even if you are not directly overlooking the coastline, beach access is never far away. We don't have big and busy facilities either, just a wonderful outdoor swimming pool and a modest, but perfectly formed clubhouse set in our historic grade II listed main building. There is also a small private gymnasium.

Venture into historic Christchurch or travel along the coast a short way to exciting Bournemouth for the very best in shopping and restaurants. There are some great attractions around the park, such as 'Adventure Wonderland' and 'Wild Thing' for the younger guests, and even a state-of-the-art Artificial Ski Centre for the more ambitious.

Sandhills is (unashamedly) not the cheapest of holiday parks, however for the discerning holiday home buyer it can represent great value in this truly unique setting. You are welcome to come and see Sandhills for yourself - so be our guest for the day. A warm welcome awaits.

blt3f7de7316333a3d6.title: Oaklands

overview.short_overview: Oaklands is ideal for those looking for a peaceful countryside setting close enough to the lively resort of Clacton-on-Sea to be accessible, but far enough away to enjoy the rural peace and quiet.
overview.long_overview:
The Park is surrounded by countryside and features an attractive and small lake as its centre piece. Fishing is available but limited; the lake is accessed via a floating pontoon. You will find that the lake is stocked with a variety of fish from Carp, Tench and Roach.

You don't have to be a fisherman to enjoy the lake as it's also an ideal sitting spot to relax and take in the local wildlife.

Don't think that Oaklands is just sleepy relaxation as there is a very friendly community of owners who get together most evenings in their onsite Foresters Tavern, and enjoy the company of like-minded people (along with sporting events on Sky or BT Sports).

For your country retreat near the coast, we have holiday homes for a wide range of budgets, and it needn't cost a fortune. Come and see us at Oaklands to find out more.

A warm welcome awaits!

blt3194a358ed60f8f2.title: New Beach

overview.short_overview: Family fun close to the Dymchurch beaches on the South Kent coast near Romney
overview.long_overview:
Come to New Beach for everything that's great about a family caravan holiday by the sea.

Oh, I do like to be beside the seaside! Well you can't get much closer to the sea than at New Beach, just over the road from the Kent coast between Dymchurch and Hythe.

You won't be short of things to do either; New Beach is in a prime location and boasts many exciting places to visit including local animal parks, a number of Theme Parks or even historic castles.

In 2018 New Beach opened a brand new Entertainment complex. Kitted out with the latest showbiz technology, and a high-tech lighting and sound system, it stages amazing West End style live shows through the holiday season. Along with a new arcade, there's also a funky bar with super-size TV screens, a restaurant, a mini-supermarket, and more.

Fancy a day exploring? New Beach provides the ideal base for discovering Kent's many interesting towns and attractions. Explore the historical town of Hythe (just 3 miles away) or pick up some bargain labelled clothes at Ashford Designer Village, only a 20 minute drive from the park. Revel in the views of nearby Lympne Castle with classic steam trains passing daily through the Kent countryside via the Romney, Hythe & Dymchurch Railway Line.

Or if that sounds a little strenuous you can always take it easy and relax on the park. For great food and drink visit our Neptune Pub & Carvery or the Restaurant & Entertainment Venue. Or perhaps take a dip in our heated indoor swimming pool - which can include brilliantly fun activities like Water Walkers and Sea Scooters.

So if you're looking for a great value Kent holiday, you can't get much better than New Beach. We look forward to welcoming you soon! Please note that to ensure everyone enjoys a great holiday and to keep traffic noise to a minimum, we request that guests park their vehicles in the main carpark located by reception.

Please advise us if you will require assistance getting from your vehicle to your accommodation.

New Beach Holiday Park - for your Kent caravan holiday home by the sea. If you like to be beside the seaside, you can't get much closer to the sea than at New Beach, just over the road from the Kent coast between Dymchurch and Hythe.

In 2018 New Beach opened a brand new Entertainment complex. Kitted out with the latest showbiz technology, and a high-tech lighting and sound system, it stages amazing West End style live shows through the holiday season. Along with a new arcade, there's also a funky bar with super-size TV screens, a restaurant, a mini-supermarket, and more. So you won't be short of things to do on park, that's for sure.

Fancy a day exploring the area? New Beach provides the perfect base for discovering Kent's many interesting towns and exciting attractions to visit. Explore the historical town of Hythe (just 3 miles away) or pick up some bargains at Ashford Designer Village, only a 20 minute drive from the park. Take in the views of nearby Lympne Castle with classic steam trains passing daily through the Kent countryside via the Romney, Hythe & Dymchurch Railway Line. Or if that sounds a little hectic just take it easy and relax in our heated indoor swimming pool on the park.

With static caravans and lodges for sale to suit all budgets, if you're looking for a great value Kent holiday home, you can't get much better than New Beach. Be our guests for the day and enjoy a guided tour of the park plus full use of all the facilities. We have lots to show you, so get in touch today!

blt7975131300366485.title: Landscove

overview.short_overview: Beautiful sea views in an idyllic setting overlooking the Devon coast in Brixham.
overview.long_overview:
Don't forget your camera when you visit Landscove! Close to the harbour town of Brixham, secret coves and beautiful views abound, with stunning seaside walks along the Devon coastal footpath offering countless sightseeing and photo opportunities.

Enjoy breathtaking scenery from the Country Park and Nature Reserve of Berry Head just next door. Landscove resides in the very best of the Devon area, and that's up against some pretty stiff competition.

Take a day trip to one of the lauded local attractions; Splashdown Water Park, Paignton Zoo, Powderham Castle, and Babbacombe Model Village are particular highlights and all offer a unique visitor experience.

On the park, choose between indoor and outdoor swimming pools, perfect for a relaxing dip and some impromptu sun bathing. Landscove Holiday Park is also the place to be for an enjoyable evening. We offer a friendly venue and great value food, so finish your day off with a tasty family meal and a drink while you watch the sun go down.

So many great reasons to visit this Devon hotspot this holiday season, we look forward to welcoming you on park soon!

overview.short_overview: Brixham, one of South Devon's most beautiful seaside towns, provides the much-coveted location for Landscove Holiday Park at Berryhead. Overlooking the beautiful Devon coast - it's a very desirable spot for your very own holiday home in Devon
overview.long_overview:
If you are looking for a holiday home on a park with spectacular views out to sea, excellent facilities, and close to the picturesque, traditional seaside town of Brixham, then Landscove Holiday park is perfect for you and your family.

With superb ocean views and great seaside walks along the Devon coastal footpath it offers countless sightseeing and leisure opportunities.

On the park you can choose between outdoor and indoor swimming pools, meaning you can even enjoy a dip if the sun is in hiding! And with a fantastic clubhouse and entertainment complex, you won't be short of things to do during those beautiful Devon summer evenings.

Landscove is somewhere special for your perfect Devon holiday home by the sea. You even have the option of making a valuable extra income by letting it when you aren't using it yourself!

We offer a range of flexible finance packages to assist with your holiday home purchase and a wide selection of static caravans and lodges to suit all budgets. To find out more, including details on holiday home running costs, get in touch today.

bltef4e1365381ba533.title: Dawlish Sands

overview.short_overview: Great location, just a short leisurely walk to a Blue Flag beach.
overview.long_overview:
Dawlish Sands Holiday Park occupies an enviable position within walking distance of a fabulous Blue Flag beach. The gently sloping golden sands of Dawlish Warren stretch out for more than 2 miles, providing an idyllic haven for swimming and splashing about.

Dawlish Sands is all about enjoying your Devon holiday the way that you want to. We have a heated indoor pool, a large sun patio and more - and it's only a short drive from Splashdown Quaywest Water Park and other fantastic local attractions.

Should you choose to stay on site there's entertainment on most weekends, with plenty of great dining choices in the clubhouse - a complex which was extensively refurbished in 2020 - take a tour here.

There's also full use of the many facilities at Golden Sands, our lively sister park nearby.

Dawlish Warren offers a warm welcome and more; we know what makes a perfect holiday in the South Devon region and our team will be more than happy to share the secret with our guests. (They might even have a few discount vouchers for popular local attractions under the desk, so don't be afraid to ask!)

The area of South Devon is renowned for its magnificent scenery with three designated Areas of Outstanding Natural Beauty, a World Heritage Coast and over 125 miles of stunning coastline. The county also has two wonderful cities as well as an eclectic mixture of picturesque towns and villages to discover.

It's all here in the perfect Devon holiday hotspot!

overview.short_overview: Dawlish Sands is perfectly situated at the heart of Dawlish Warren, a short flat stroll from one of Devon's finest beaches. With great facilities and entertainment, plus use of our neighbouring Golden Sands Holiday Park facilities too.
overview.long_overview:
Dawlish Sands Holiday Park occupies an enviable position within flat walking distance of Devon's fabulous Blue Flag Dawlish Warren beach. And with an easy drive from Exeter it makes it one of the South West's most accessible destinations.

The gently sloping golden sands of Dawlish Warren stretch out for more than 2 miles, providing an idyllic and safe haven for swimming or splashing about.

Surrounded by beautiful countryside and close to the beach, Dawlish Sands Holiday Park is a perfect choice for your Devon Holiday Home. We have some great facilities including an indoor pool and clubhouse, a complex which has been extensively refurbished in 2020 - take a tour here.

South Devon is one of the most picturesque areas in the UK with three designated Areas of Outstanding Natural Beauty, a World Heritage Coast and over 125 miles of stunning coastline. The region also has two vibrant cities as well as an eclectic mixture of coastal and rural towns and villages to explore.

Caravan holiday homes and lodges at Dawlish Sands come in a wide range of models to suit all budgets, and you can even earn an extra income with the option to let when you are not using it yourself.

We also offer a range of flexible finance packages to assist with your holiday home purchase, to find out more including details on holiday home running costs, you can get in touch today. Call now or visit us at the sales office at nearby Golden Sands Holiday Park.

blta499b49992b0c0dd.title: Beauport

overview.short_overview: Beauport has a real country club atmosphere, centred around its clubhouse which is a great place for making friends and offers great value wining and dining 7 days a week!
overview.long_overview:
Beauport - a very special place! With an extended season of 11.5 months, Beauport park is a beautifully landscaped park nestled on a wooded hillside on the outskirts of Hastings, with easy access from the A21. Regarded as one of the most scenic areas in the region, it's a popular choice for both caravan and lodge owners.

Your neighbours will include deer, badgers and other visitors to the park, it's a nature lover's paradise! Beauport has a real country club community atmosphere, centered around its friendly bar. Owners can also use the gym, swimming pool and play area. There are 2 golf courses nearby, so you can take advantage of wonderful scenery and unspoiled nature, plus there's the Bannatyne Spa Hotel & Health Club next door.

With caravan holiday homes and lodges for a range of budgets, your Sussex holiday home could cost less than you might imagine. And with an extended 11.5 month season, you can visit as often a you like throughout the season! So come on down and visit us soon for your introduction to holiday home ownership, a warm welcome awaits!

We also offer a range of flexible finance packages to assist with your holiday home purchase, so get in touch to find out more.

bltcd0d31e5dacf6102.title: Alberta

overview.short_overview: Right by the beach, just a short stroll into famous Whitstable on the North Kent coast
overview.long_overview:
Alberta is a great holiday base to explore the Kent area, with Whitstable only a short drive away.

Situated in Seasalter and very close to the beach, you'll feel like you can relax from the moment that you arrive. There's a heated outdoor pool and children's splash pool to enjoy and so much to do around the park too.

Visit our family friendly clubhouse serving food and beverages throughout the day (openings times may vary) with regular cabaret acts, and live sporting events on Sky and BT Sports.

Nearby Whitstable is famous for its oysters, but don't feel you have to try them - like Marmite, you'll either love them or hate them!

One of the many reasons people come to Alberta is because it's so very easy to get to on the North Kent coast. You can be relaxing by the pool while others are still stuck in traffic!

If you do fancy a trip out for the day - there's Canterbury with its stunning cathedral and historical architecture, Herne Bay, Rochester, and the coastal resorts of Margate, Ramsgate and Folkestone to explore.

France is actually closer than you may think, so you might even have time to top up with duty free before you leave!

So many great reasons to visit Alberta, we look forward to seeing you on park soon!

highlights.subtitle: Quirky shops, oysters, and the English seaside

overview.short_overview: The beautiful region of North Kent's Garden of England is a perfect place to own your new Holiday Home. Alberta Holiday Park in Whitstable has a great location with which to fully enjoy all the pleasures of this beautiful region.
overview.long_overview:
Alberta in Whitstable - for your holiday home on the Kent coast. Situated in Seasalter next to Whitstable and right by the beach you'll feel relaxed from the moment that you arrive. There's a great swimming pool to enjoy on those hot summer days, but there's so much more to do off the park as well.

Whitstable is famous for its oysters, but don't feel you have to try them, like Marmite, you'll either love them or hate them! Many people choose Alberta because it's so easy to travel to from London, and the South East. It really is the ideal place for your Kent holiday home by the sea, with historic Canterbury, and the nearby coastal resorts of Herne Bay, Rochester, and Margate ready to be explored.

With a fantastic range of holiday homes for all budgets it may cost less than you think. You can even enjoy a valuable income with the option to sublet when you're not using it yourself. We also offer a range of flexible finance packages to assist with your holiday home purchase, so why not get in touch to find out more today?
